Then we crossed the bridge and it’s up up up the stairs which gets you up about 1/3 of the elevation back to the start point. Stairs aren’t too bad. Finish is uphill trail with some nice views back to the lake. 5 miles total for our hike. Loved it!
Everything is very dry here. Just a trickle over the waterfall and a few puddles in the riverbed. Enjoyable morning but limited views due to the drought.
The gorge is really beautiful and grand - my only complaint is lack of water. Ithaca needs a good rainfall to get the water flowing.
short but good view!
Falls were sadly dry, but overall easy hike and rock formations were cool.
Incredible gorge/waterfall at the end.
Easy stroll.  A few little side trips onto the dry riverbed.  Good for any age
Easy trail on gravel. Falls did not have a lot of water but still impressive. Brought our dog for a nice morning walk
It was okay. Wasn’t much water on the falls. But the hike itself wasn’t hard more medium and up hill. I went around instead of parking the car and taking the shorter way.
It was to dry to really appreciate the fall. The place was beautiful . No where to swim
Amazing
Easy. Good for kids. You can walk out by the river. Water was low so waterfall wasn’t very powerful.
easy path, fun to walk on the creek when it’s dry, the falls are pretty! informative plaques along the way. not too crowded.
Easy. Flat. Quick. Do it early before crowds of families with kids get there.  Then do the North Rim/South Rim loop. That’s the fun one.
We did the rim trail and the gorge trail. Rim trail had some nice views but the gorge trail was more enjoyable. Family of 4 with a 9 and 11 your old.
Wow
AMAZING!
Easy stroll, nice view
Amazing waterfall! Definitely try to go earlier, it was super busy. Most people wearing masks but not all. Super dog friendly.
Low key hike, beautiful rock formations. not such of a waterfall to see today but glad I came. Bathrooms were open & not busy on a Tuesday afternoon.

Unique hike. The kids (3&5) loved walking in the waterbed, jumping in puddles, and climbing over the mini waterfalls on the way to the huge (high, not necessarily a ton of water) payoff at the end. Easy trail walk back.
The advertised falls is what drew us out here. Unfortunately, the falls are dried up, leaving this to be a very unfulfilling walk on a well maintained path. Lovely park and water access though.
This was a fun after work walk. Waterfall is barley flowing, but you're able to walk down and around in the gorge. It's really neat.

Easy trail with a beautiful waterfall at the end.  If kids take water shoes they can play in the water on the walk up.  Very pretty.  Rented kayaks in the state park by the little beach after the hike.
Easy trail, little water. Couldn’t swim
Good trail and waterfall other than the fact that the waterfall wasn’t flowing that much
super easy, barely an inconvenience

My boyfriend and I love to take our dog on this trail, and recently we’ve been going weekly. It is very easy and accessible to all skill-levels, with a few benches along the way. It is definitely a clear trail, not rocky or full of roots. Beautiful view at the falls. Mostly shaded. I do this in sneakers, not my hiking boots, and it’s just good exercise on a nice day. Highly recommend! Please be mindful during COVID of social distancing and masks. They prefer you put your mask on when it’s crowded. It can get crowded at some points. I wear my mask below my chin and pull up over my nose when folks pass by. Swimming is actually prohibited there. But to walk along some wet parts to the side of the trails, I recommend water shoes. The dog would love to splash there, too! I don’t know what that part is called but you can see it on your right (all of the rock) as you go up the trail. There are a few spots to get back and forth.
easy walk with beautiful views of the falls at the end. no water at present but still a nice morning stroll
Really great trail! Had so much fun with my teenage boys. They can’t wait to come back
easy trail beautiful views
Beautiful views both from the rim and from the gorge. One of us walked with the kids down the rim trail and the other parked at the gorge and joined us below.
Stairs at the beginning were a nice start, pretty overlook of the falls. Not a challenging hike, very doable!
definitely a family friendly trail, i went in late july and it was a little crowded for my liking. but the falls were nice. lots of people walking in the water as well
East trail walk. Falls are nice, somewhat light if little rain beforehand.

For a photo map, parking location, and a trail recording, go to https://www.alltrails.com/explore/recording/taughannock-falls-via-gorge-trail-da87cbc   Taughannock Falls is a single waterfall, which is 215 feet, making it taller than Niagara Falls. Gorge Trail takes you to the base of the falls, as it meanders alongside a creek through a very deep gorge (400ft), and was once the bed of an ancient sea. The creek has plenty of opportunities to give your dog a drink, wet your feet, or even take a dip. The water was rather low while I was there due to lack of rain in mid-summer. Gorge Trail from the parking lot to the falls is more like a dirt road. It is very easy to walk, push a stroller, etc, with no steps or inclines. When you get to the base of the falls, the view looking up at it will definitely put a smile on your face. I also saw many raptors (eagles?, hawks?) soaring above the falls while I was there. Very cool! But then a thunderstorm rolled in, right when I was in the water under the falls. Things got sketchy really quick, but I was lucky enough to get out and back to the car before things got dicey.   The Gorge Trail parking lot is across the street from Cayuga Lake, where there is additional parking, restrooms, swimming, a picnic area, concessions, a playground, boating, etc. Parking is $8 at state parks, but keep in mind that you only pay once per day, no matter how many state parks you go to. Just keep your receipt to show the attendant.   May you always find peace in the scent of fresh air, in the way breeze feels against your skin, in the glistening reflection of a splashing creek, and in the sound of wind in the trees. Stay humble. Stay kind. Stay thankful. Keep hope. Keep smiling. Keep laughing. Love and respect nature, because that is where you will find a true lifetime of happiness! Also love and respect everyone who crosses your path. There is a reason why they did. If I see you on the trail, I promise to say "Hi" :-)

Nice easy trail. Great for kids and dogs. We walk the creek until you see the sign that says return to main trail. Well maintained trail and has some benches for breaks. Went on 7/21/20 and water flow was low but still flowing. Kids had fun splashing in the water.

(July 21st 2020) Beautiful hike, we also went down the trail to the falls (added an extra 2mi I think). Good hike for the pups, when we went it was super dry, must be a drought.. we went on a Tuesday, crowded on the lower trail but pretty low to moderate traffic for us on the upper trails. Signs say no swimming everywhere but we saw a few people swimming, mostly kids. There were a few spots on the lower stream were there weren’t any people. so we were able to take the pups off the leash so they could swim in a few of the watering holes.(not sure if you could do that on a weekend). Breathtaking views.

Beautiful falls and a very easy trail. We were staying at a hotel at the Trail Head so I went on Friday evening and got to walk a majority of the riverbed. It is slippery at parks so wear proper boots if you plan to do that. Otherwise the trail is super easy and the view is killer.  We went back Sunday morning after the massive rains and the falls went from a trickle to a thunderous roar. If you can catch the falls after a rainy day, you will be blown away.

Super easy trail (only one open due to COVID-19) for a great payoff. The waterfall is spectacular. Lots of places to walk up along the rocky bed of the gorge, next time we’ll wear hiking sandals or water shoes.

Probably one of my favorite easy trail with a view to kill for, so you can drive up to the lookout point and get a great view of taughannock falls, then drive down into the park and hike less than a mile into the fall. Just a breathtaking view!

Took my eight year old boys there - Easy to socially distance and hike.  Extremely wide path. Much of river bed is walkable.  Easy in/out and shaded for a good part if you are there early. We got there just before 9am and fortuitously avoided the State Park fee.
Such an easy little walking trail, it was a perfect start to our morning. You could even walk along the water with all of the dry rock. The water is beautiful!!
Easy trail for children, including toddlers. Off-road stroller can make it.

Easy and quick trail to the falls, handicap accessible, beautiful views the whole way, many spots to go in the water all along the trail up to the falls, felt more like a bike path than a hiking trail but was nice
Beautiful waterfall and easy trail when following the gorge trail.
(August 2019)  Easy walk down a dirt road to the lookout at the bottom of the falls. Make sure you see it from above at the viewpoint as well.
easy walk on a dirt road. The falls are just spectacular. Try to find the other falls on the map- great fun!
Beautiful waterfall! Fun to walk in the water on hot days.

We walked the south rim trail to north rim trail. then out and back to the falls. If anyone wanted to save themselves a hike, there is a parking lot for upper falls view. Due to current social distancing, trails are one way so be sure to follow along.  Porta potties available since restrooms aren't available to public at this time.
North - Gorge - South Rim recording - beautiful
Very beautiful trail! You can walk on the well maintained trail or you can walk the water bed. Leads to a waterfall and is stroller friendly!
amazing place, easy trail, kids had a blast walking through the water on the way back from the fall
Beautiful!! Nice little walk out to the waterfall! Great paths and all in the shade!
Very high trafficked , nice easy well kept trail

Easy walk to a beautiful waterfalls. We got there early, around 9am, and the lot was already starting to fill up. They have cones in between every other parking spot to promote social distancing so the lot won’t be at max capacity.
Busy there today, but always beautiful!

Great short trail. The trail itself was lovely. But literally packed. Even during the week. No efforts by most to cover their face or even try and walk on the other side of the trail.  Kids everywhere running into you. People letting their dogs do whatever.   I’ve done a lot of hiking during the covid shutdowns and this was by far the worst experience I’ve had as far as people being respectful about social distancing.
Very easy and wide trail along the creek with fairly impressive falls at the end.
Awesome little walk with an amazing view
amazing but take the time and walk the rim. less people. beautiful
Awesome trail to hike from the top its got great views and from the bottom as well. Lots of people and dogs all over.

Rained the whole drive up. Quarantine 2020 in full swing. Wore our masks. Rain stopped once we arrived. 50° & cloudy. Saw seven hawks flying together and geese flying through the gorge. Ithaca Ale House for Thanksgiving sandwich take out, no dining in restaurants because of the quarantine.
Pictures don’t really do the hike justice. It’s very easy hike but very Good scenery. Falls are very unique and amazing.

Very easy trail and not really a hike,  but a beautiful walk especially in the winter. The frozen falls were spectacular and we saw several bald eagles. There is some  ice on the trail but it was cindered in most areas.
Nice little hike. Once you get there, the waterfall is breath taking. Took my pup and he loved it.

I’ve hiked this trail many times before and the waterfall is just as beautiful every time! It’s amazing how a couple of weeks with above freezing temperatures changes the way the entire waterfall looks!
super easy. wheelchair doable. cinders. outstanding views. flat trail.
Winter in Taughannock Canyon is something else! highly recommended
Part of south rim trail closed. There is probably some alternate but I could not find it. North rim open with a detour for the stairs.
Lovely, short hike to the falls. For people new to the area, this is the only Gorge Trail open during the winter. The trail is flat, but was a little muddy today
A great walk in every season. The result at the end is so gorgeous and beautiful.
What an awesome short hike that’s very easy to an amazing waterfall!!  Highly recommend this hike.
Amazing view for very little effort. Easy flat and fast, just bring waterproof shoes.

Went last October and the waterfall is spectacular!  We want to come back here during the Spring when the water is probably flowing best.  Awesome out and back hike, though.  Wide trails and easily navigated by all ages.  We saw folks with strollers and others in wheelchairs.  Very accessible.
Easy hike- easy trail with instant gratification
Wonderful easy hike. Most hikes are far more challenging for such an awesome sight at the end
awesome view
Awesome quick hike to a massive waterfall.
awesome trail with great views along the way. Wide open and shaded. Easy for all ages and handicap accessible to. Great view of the falls at the end.
Nice easy trail.  Beautiful view looking up from the bottom of the falls.  Also neat that you could walk along the trail or out along the rock in the creek bed.
Flat and mostly shaded, and it ends at the base of the falls. This trail never disappoints!!
Very easy hike with a beautiful waterfall and surroundings
Loved the walk. We went to the overlook at the top of the falls first and then walked up the rim trail and back the gorge trail. Very nice walk. The falls are beautiful from the bottom and the top.
Nice easy trial and dog friendly. Beautiful waterfall.

Great little walk in an open canyon valley that ends with a pretty waterfall. You can wade through the water or walk in the basin where the stream runs. Not too crowded and mostly in the shade. Path is in very good condition.
Very easy, nice trial that takes you to a lovely waterfall. More of a stroll than a hike. Tallest one in the NE. Kid and dog friendly.
This was pretty uninteresting as far as the hike was concerned. Perhaps when the water level is higher there is more to see.
Super easy walk, not really what I would call a hike.  Lots of people and families.  The view of the falls is spectacular which made the walk worthwhile.  Shaded the whole way and flat as a pancake.
this is a beautiful spot. great for kids to do. we loved walking into he middle of the water most of the way. great for kids and breath taking. easier trail.
Amazing easy trail, beautiful falls :)
beautiful easy walk. great trail, the waterfall is so cool!
Super easy hike. The end waterfall was amazing. So worth the hike.
Quick and easy one mile hike to the Falls! Very cool trail!

One of those beautifully short in and out hikes, smooth wide gravel path. Very popular, but you can get down into the water at several points and even walk in the water for most of the way.  Great for Dogs on leash with lots of people around. No biking on this portion of Taughannock. Rather flat gorge trail that ends with scenic view from base of large, narrow waterfall. No swimming on the trail, but plenty of places to wade and get your feet wet. Swimming is easily accessed from a stone beach in the lake on the south east side of Taughannock State Park.
excellent trail & reward at the end.  loved walking through the water!
Can't ask for an easier hike for the views you get! Beautiful waterfall.

This was our first hike with the whole family including our 2 1/2 year old.  We didn’t take the stroller cause we wanted to see how the little one would do.  The two kids both did great.  A very busy trail and we saw a number of people with a stroller.  I would say that it IS stroller friendly.  Very easy walk for everyone including the kids.
Highly crowded hike due to its easy paved walk to the falls. Highly recommend it if you are around the Keuka lake region.
Breathtaking and an easy hike
beautiful, easy trail. Access to large park with bbqs across the road. Lots of parking. Washrooms too.
Absolutely stunning waterfall. Definitely a must do if you’re in the area!
Beautiful, easy hike.
Peaceful. Very easy. Pretty falls. Most people can do this one. Fun to play in the creek.
simple hike up gorge to large waterfall
Very easy trail with nice views. Populated. I’ll have to try the other trails!

Not a bad trail at all, not too much elevation gain. It seems most of the uphill is on the way to the fall, and it feels much easier to walk back. If you are in the area, I recommend it!  We went after 6pm, so was not charged to park. Since it was a weekday evening, there were very few people, and in fact, we had the falls to ourselves for about 25 minutes!

Not a bad trail at all, not too much elevation gain. It seems most of the uphill is on the way to the fall, and it feels much easier to walk back. If you are in the area, I recommend it!  We went after 6pm, so was not charged to park. Since it was a weekday evening, there were very few people, and in fact, we had the falls to ourselves for about 25 minutes!

Go early and don’t pay $8 to park . Well maintained and beautiful . Quick hike too no more than hour total and that was taking our sweet time . Beautiful limestone rock bed on stream and sharp steep cliffs , largest single drop for waterfall east of Colorado river .
Not my favorite waterfall trail in the area (yay Buttermilk Falls!) but worth doing for a quick hike. Very easy out and back.
Dog friendly, easy walk to the falls. Really pretty and peaceful.
Crowded but worth the short hike. Spectacular falls!
Nice easy out and back hike. April 13, 2019 the trail was a little wet and muddy.
Hike in the canyon if you can! Bring your waterproof shoes!
completely flat wide path to waterfall. my favorite waterfall in the finger lakes. unfortunately no swimming,.
The perfect trail for a super easy walk. Waterfall is still roaring with a cold spray off. Definitely recommend for a quick nature walk.
trail was closed due to ice
Trail was very easy and breathtakingly beautiful with the snow and ice. It was a very cold day but well worth the mile walk to the waterfall.

This is a super fun trail with stunning views. We walked the North Rim in the snow without a problem, but South Rim was closed for weather so we had to double back instead of looping like we had planned. We still enjoyed it and plan to go back when the snow melts!
Very easy hike! Beautiful waterfall at the end! Usually very busy on weekends.
Extremely easy, flat trail. Not very long and all open trail. Perfect with kids and dogs. Beautiful falls at the end.
beautiful when there has been a lot of rain
easy trail. pretty scenery
Spectacular waterfall really tall and some tall gorges surrounding the pool of water below.  Love this hike
Very nice/easy flat hike. Beautiful waterfall. Very tall. One of the prettiest.
A nice easy walk with a spectacular view of Taughannock Falls. Lots of people coming & going but never too crowded to get nice photos. The gorge is as spectacular as the actual falls.
A nice easy walk with a spectacular view of Taughannock Falls. Lots of people coming & going but never too crowded to get nice photos. The gorge is as spectacular as the actual falls.
Easy hike to a beautiful waterfall. you can get close enough to feel the most off the falls.
A divine waterfall. The scenery surrounding the waterfall is wonderful
Great and Easy hike! Beautiful waterfall :)
Easy out and back to a beautiful waterfall.
easy out and back trail along gorge creek to the falls.

Easy trail out and back 3/4 of a mile. Glorious waterfall at the end. (I should add the waterfall is only glorious if there’s been considerable rain lately)We did walk in the water for a bit but it is super slippery so we got out and back on the trail. We also spent sometime at the beach across the street which was crowded but the water was so refreshing that we didn’t care.
incredible place.

Excellent walk. Blue Stone path extremely wide. Wheelchair friendly with a little assistance. Kid friendly also. Fall was beautiful. Definitely would do again. And would like to hike a few trails next time.
Have done this trail a couple times and will plan to do again in the future!
Easy out and back trail.  We went in the evening after a light rain.  Not many people, and doing the trail in the evening gave it a very different feel.  The falls are beautiful.

We went to the overlook point n saw and we were not thrilled and then we drove to the gorge trail head, We started the hike and its less than a mile once we reached the falls it was surely a great feeling. We went after heavy rains so we could see decent amount of water but if you go in mid summer I doubt if you can hardly enjoy the falls. The gorge trail head is right next to Cayuga so we spent some time there as well, worth a visit!!
Amazing trail ! Going again this weekend.
Taughannock is one of my favorite NYS parks. A must see

did this with my wife, mother and a 6 and 2 year old. My mom isn't much of a hiker so she thought it was long but it isn't. LOL. Its a pretty easy trail, the waterfall at the end is clearly the main attraction and the perspective from the bottom is spectacular. Good family hike.
Nice easy hike to the falls, optional walk along the creek bed in sections. Good for kids and dogs!
just went today, there was just a trinkle of water where there is normally a big fall, which is disappointing. normally a beautiful spot however!
Well maintained. Lovely walk
Very easy walk towards the waterfall. The hike around the rim is a nice walk but the views are not as great as expected. Some days the waterfall is underwhelming.
Nice walk around the rim. Mostly flat and graveled trail. Pushed my son with his broken femur in wheelchair. A few little incline workouts with the wheelchair, but no problem overall.
Very easy. Lots of shade. A lot of people. Great hike after finishing the Rim Trails.
Nice hike around the rim. It’s about 4 miles. Great views. The gorge trail is spectacular. Super easy. You can walk the entire length in the water. Great for kids. Can catch Minos and crayfish.

The gorge trail was heavily trafficked today. It is a nice flat trail with the option of walking in the streambed, as long as the park patrol does not care. The reward at the end is a great view of the waterfall. It is more impressive from the view from the South Rim trail.

Walked this gorge trail first before tackling the rim trail. It's beautiful inside the gorge - don't forget to look up along the walls! Read the interpretive signage along the way, too. If you prefer to avoid lots of people, go early in the day (and get good parking!). Accessible to wheelchairs, and seating for those who experience fatigue.

Walked this gorge trail first before tackling the rim trail.  It's beautiful inside the gorge - don't forget to look up along the walls!  Read the interpretive signage along the way, too. If you prefer to avoid lots of people, go early in the day (and get good parking!).
Pretty cool to think this waterfall is taller than Niagara Falls. Nice trail.
Phenomenal views of the falls. Has the option for an easier trail or more moderate trail.

Taughannock Falls is an exceptional family hike to an impressive waterfall. If you have time for only one waterfall visit, this is the one. Park in the Taughannock State Park lots near the trailhead. The trail itself is nearly flat and is wide enough for several people to walk side by side. Many walk the creekbed up to the falls while other prefer the trail. This is an great ADA-accessible trail well-suited for both elderly, strollers, and wheel chairs. Once you complete this short- flat hike, drive up to the viewing area on Taughannock Park Road for other equally great views.
Nice flat. Walk with little elevation. I hit the lookout first and then hit the trail. Wonderful pictures.
Nice and easy hike. Very icy. Micro spikes made it a breeze.
Cool

Was worried that the trail would be too slippery and icy with the warmer weather during our hike, but wasn't bad at all. Be prepared for lots of people and dogs, but a nice quick hike with beautiful scenery that never gets old!
Beautiful trails! I was there on 1/1/18 and the falls were gorgeous!
Easy trail with a beautiful waterfall at the end.
Loved it, truly breathtaking the rock walls are Huge! Any one w camera would love this trail I went my family, at the end of the trail you see the waterfall up close.

I do this trail every time I come to Ithaca. love this wide dirt trail easy walk to beautiful fall. the trail at the base walks you to the lower platform but then at the top of the hill there is a scenic parking area to get the above view of the falls
Go after a few days of rainfall! Makes all the difference
Super easy trail but definitely worth it! Very scenic. Lots of friendly dogs as well!
Easy walk to the falls. Be sure to visit the overlook as well.
nice walk with good views of the gorge walls. the waterfall at the end is also a great site to see
Beautiful, easy trail with a gorgeous waterfall at its end. Great place to take kids and pets.

This is a very easy hike to the base of the falls. It is a direct, flat wide path and you can easily hike this trail without hiking shoes or boots. The trail is parallel to a river for its entire length. The trail is open to the sun at times and covered by trees at other points.   Things to know:  You can not actually get to the base of the falls as the trail ends at an outlook which is a safe distance from the falls and any falling rocks  Wear water shoes if possible as you can walk in the flat bed river next to the trail and the kids love this  Across the street is a state park which you can walk  or drive to. There is a large playground there and places to grill and eat right on the water
Short busy trail with great views.

Amazing waterfall - goes without saying.  It was extremely enjoyable for me to walk up the mostly dry bed to the waterfall.  The area is so open and surrounded by tall stone on either side - it was a really cool experience.  While I enjoyed the easy hike out and back, if you are looking for a photo opp I would suggest stopping at the overlook at the top.

An easy hike to the falls along a gravel path. Falls are spectacular. You can walk along the riverbed, if the water level is low, and get a unique viewpoint you cannot get from the trail. Bring water shoes if you want to do this.
Spectacular waterfall! I recommend to get there before 8AM to avoid crowds. The sun lights the fall by 9AM in August!
Beautiful view of the waterfall. The walk is extremely easy and relatively short, but the view alone makes up for it. Perfect background for pictures that want to truly encapsulate Ithaca's beauty.
This is a nice hike around the top of the gorge to the main viewing spot for the falls. We saw a falcon which was amazing.
Very easy stroll. Wide path. Lovely waterfall. Easily combined w another state park on same day.
great spot for pictures
Easy flat hard pack dirt trail leads to beautiful falls at the end. Couldn't get a good picture at the very end due to so much mist from the base of the falls.
Love the trail and falls.  I highly recommend going past the main entrance and heading up the hill to the two overlooks. Water flow was a little low when I went but still absolutely beautiful falls!
Beautiful, well traveled, and easy trail. Took my parents when they came to visit and they were very impressed.
Was great with all the recent rain.
great hike if you do the loop taking the north rim trail to the south rim trail, about 3 miles with ups and downs. Great views!!

This is one of my favorite short distance, easy hikes in the Finger Lakes region. The gorge trail is beautiful and the cliffs extend really high.  The creek bed was pretty dry on my last visit (due to drought conditions), but there's usually ankle deep water flowing that you can take off your shoes and walk in. The rock is flat & smooth there also.   The falls are higher than Niagara Falls, but very narrow. They were just a trickle during our last visit, but they are still majestic. There is also a great lookout from the upper rim that is a really good place for photos.    The gorge trail is short, less than a mile and is very easy. We did this as a 2nd hike for the day and we were in & out in less than 2 hours. The gorge trail is good for dogs and children. I definitely would recommend this one for the views alone.

What a gorgeous park, my jaw dropped at every corner.  I parked in the lot off Jacksonville road (free) then hiked down the South Rim Trail, out and back the Gorge Trail, and up the North Rim Trail to finish the loop. There had been a good amount of rain so the falls were majestic!  Be sure to check out the Upper Falls where the North and South Rim Trails meet at the top. Trails were well maintained, stone stairs as the trails come out near the lake. Will definitely be back again!
Stunning and majestic waterfall!
So beautiful. Just very icy and muddy towards the falls.
Gorgeous view on a beautiful day. Most parts of the trail were really icy though.
fun hike with an amazing waterfall
even great in November. wheelchair friend too. saw the super moon on the way home. it was 5 times bigger in the sky. by the time i got the chance to pullover on the highway it was smaller.

October 2016 - the falls are still pretty dried out from the summer drought but the fall colors were absolutely beautiful! The colors were at peak and the forests was filled with so many beautiful colors! Nice hike for families and even elders

The gorge is worth the drive and the walk. There wasn't much water flowing while we were there, but the gorge was still amazing. I thought the signs about the falling rock was a little much, but then were heard a loud crack and several pieces of shale broke away and dropped into the pool and the bottom of the falls. Parking is limited at the bottom trail head. New bathrooms and information center recently opened the overlook. the upper falls and gorge were worth a look as well.
Loved this though the gorge trail was boring the rim trail was magnificent lots and lots of Falcons and Hawks and stuff very cool
Easy hike and the trails are always maintained. Best to go during the week, there's always a crowd and sometimes parking can be skinny. The gorge is gorgeous!

because of the draught there is no water on the riverbed or waterfalls, however still a very nice scenic walk through the gorge trail. it is closed halfway through due to landslide, but they created a path through the riverbed to help counter that.
Scenic area with several hiking options from accessible to moderate

Hiked this with my infant, dog and husband. There is a drought going on now but it still really is beautiful! I would recommend the gorge trail for those with your little one that begins at the bottom going straight to the waterfall, shaded and it's not steep. It's closed half way there but you can walk on the dried river bed towards the falls. The rim trail going up from gorge trail is pretty steep and there are several roots on the floor so watch your step, but it has points where you can stop and sightsee, and it's shaded as well. I'm definently coming back during the fall!
Quick and easy! Loved seeing the turkey vultures at first from the ground and then getting a closer view on the upper trail.
Beautiful setting.  When we were there the water was really flowing!  Wedding took place overlooking the Fall.  It was gorgeous.
Easiest trail in the world being flat and 20 feet wide. Suggest walking thru the water up to the falls!

If you are here for the falls, you can only see the upper viewpoint. The lower view point is closed. It is only worth driving to the top and view the falls. The open trails are boring and the view point along the trail does not show much. The marina looks happening. Would have been a better trip if the lower access trail was available.
well landscaped path, not very long and that will take you to a spectacular fall. you can walk in the river which is a flat rock.

Disappointed, Gorge was closed when I got there. Went hiking and the trails lead no where.  I do have to say the park marina is beautiful and the park staff great.  However, my overall experienced did not meet my expectations.
The lower trail is easy and stroller friendly.
Love this park. Always a family favorite.

Breathtaking waterfall!  We hiked up the hill from the bottom parking lot to get to the top of the falls and did not think the trail was worth the hike (nothing to see).  There is a parking lot at the top of the falls, which we knew, but we thought the trail might have had something to offer that we'd miss by just walking from the parking lot.. Nope.  It was a nice walk in the woods anyhow..  The trail that leads to the bottom of the falls was really a flat, easy, beautiful walk to a gorgeous waterfall.  We could've sat there all day.  Love that it's open year round.  Perfect place for children or elderly people that want to see Falls but can't climb stairs or hills.
Waterfall is beautiful!
Beautiful in Autumn. Nice relaxing walk with plenty to see. It's very popular so don't expect seclusion.
Have been coming here 30 years. Now my husband and I bring our little girl. Love this place...
Walked up on south rim and back down on north rim. Better views on south.
Beautiful and relaxing.
Beautiful! Nice walk to gorge
Very easy walk with an amazing waterfall at the end!

Definitely recommend for the everyday walker/hiker, but views that anyone can appreciate. Beautiful walk. Not too hard at all. Brought my wife and my daughter (in a stroller). We actually went during/after a heavy rain fall so the waterfall was in full force. Beautiful scenery, and the park and marina are right there across the road from the entrance.
Easy urban trail. Scenic falls.
Always a favorite; a nice hike up the rim trail before getting to the waterfall.
Wow, spectacular view
Amazing view in the winter. Very easy hike that anyone could complete.
beautiful hike and nice swim at the falls...
Beautiful waterfall....extremely easy walk. Definitely would recommend it!!!
A nice hike (rim trail) after kayaking from Myers Park;
Nice hike ...easy hike huge falls huge cliffs

(my distance and strenuousness noted include the rim trail)  A truly spectacular waterfall!  The gravel path down the gorge is popular, being an easy and mostly flat 1.5 miles down to the falls and back. In the hotter months, it's fun take off your shoes and walk in the creek.  I really enjoy the lesser traveled rim trail (which is just a bit longer distance) that you can hike as a loop up one side and down the other. It affords some pretty spectacular overlooks of the gorge and the falls. The grade can be very aggressive at times. In taking this trail, you're a lot less likely to share the trail with many other hikers.
Dry summer this year, just rained this week and made the waterfall....a waterfall again. Not a huge flow but one hell of a nice 200 foot drop.
A fairly easy in and out hike with a stunning waterfall mid-way.
nice walk falls was beautiful with some ice on the cliffs.
this is another gem , this is the largest drop on the east coast. Its a shame that people can not follow the rules!!!!!!!!
Dry enough season to walk across the river to the falls. Great scenery!
My boyfriend and I were just driving around and accidentally found this hidden treasure! Easy walk and beautiful view!

A simple, level trail from NY Route 89 to the (nearly) base of Taughannock Falls, New York's highest but nowhere near largest. Open all year, except when very icy. Stay away from base of falls (beyond the signs). A woman was killed by ignoring this. A good hike for visiting relatives, not at all strenuous.I've done this walk on many days, from Christmas (nobody there - 10 degrees) to summer solstice (full moon -- illegal night walk).
Tallest falls on the east coast
awesome. great gorge trail 200-400 foot cliffs on either side and a 215ft waterfall at the end!

Taughannock Falls North Rim Trail.Name: Taughannock Falls North Rim Trail

parking lot: NY 89, eight miles north of Ithaca to the Main Entrance.

More Info: Part of interconnected trail system: Yes
Use of firearms for deer hunting is not allowed. Bow hunting may be allowed. BE SAFE: See the specific trail owner/steward’s website for the most up to date details

Reviews.comment: Did the North Rim trail first, and then the Gorge trail, and then the South Rim trail. Beautiful views, even in the rain! Everything was clearly marked and the trails were well maintained. Maybe just watch out for the slippery rock steps when it's rainy.

Was a beautiful day trail was clear and marked. Recommend going early morning  by 1030 trail was getting busy.  We actually started on the south rim which met up to North rim and really enjoyed the views along the way.
Best scenic trail for amazing views!!!
Stunning views of the falls! A must see!
A little muddy, blue bird day, cool temps.

Absolutely wonderful. I suggest starting on North rim trail as it is basically uphill the whole way and less scenic than south, but definitely still worth the trip amazing view points. Once you get half way there is another trail it is the gorge trail out and back very heavily trafficked. The gorge trail is like nothing we’ve seen before, seeing the rock layers up close and the ability to walk on the rock of the fall.
Great views of the falls!
A little muddy in spots. Beautiful March day!
Pretty views, well walked path with lots of waterfall views. Only did the north rim, there and back because the south rim trail was closed at the entrance of the mail falls park.

This really is an easy trail unless you have bad knees... it's gravel/ paved all along. There are steps at the end, but only about three flights.  Assuming you do both rims and the gorge trail, I'd recommend the North rim first, which has views of the falls.  Seeing them from a distance is really exciting and builds the anticipation!  Then do the gorge trail.  Then do the South Rim to finish up.    We took about 2 1/2 hours to do this full loop, including the gorge trail to the base of the falls, and didn't particularly rush.
Awesome 1st day of the year hike  Short and sweet love Ithaca

Enjoyable hike/walk through the woods with views of the gorge and falls. We did the North Rim first, then the gorge trail (out and back) and then used the South Rim trail to bring us back to where we parked.
Great moderate hike, good for someone looking to prep for the Adirondacks.  The steeper parts, give you an idea.  Great waterfalls, trails are well paved.

Great moderate hike! We started on the South Trail and looped over to the North Trail after doing the quick Gorge Trail. So glad we did that because the surprise views along the way really made the day well spent!

Made the most out of a rainy day, so of course there was no one on the trail! I would rate it a moderate hike because of the stairs that you had to climb a few times. Also do the North rim trail first and then the south rim. I think that's the best way to get the full experience of the loop!
It’s like a walk in the park. I don’t mean it’s easy - well, it’s moderately challenging-  but it’s not terribly scenic with wire fencing all along the gorge.
Lots of steps to start and then rewarded with a beautiful view and fairly flat trail
Still fairly crowded on weekends, especially the gorge trail and overlook.  Lots of turkey vultures flying around in easy view from North Rim. Good mask wearing in late October though.

Fall colors not quite peak but still amazing. The Trail on both north and south is well maintained with very little root trip hazards. Incline intense in short burst at lake end of both trail heads but not entire trail so don’t worry. It is easier to start on the south trail heading west than it was the north trail. If you are starting on the west side parking lot then take the north trail first. The incline on the north trail on the east side is pretty long compared to the south trail on the east side. $8 parking per car at east side through Oct 18th then free after that. Highly suggest bringing your trekking poles, made it must more enjoyable on moderate trails.
Nice short flat trail at the bottom ,,.. beautiful View
Beautiful view of the falls, but they were just a trickle at this time of year.

I prefer this trail over the Gorge trail in the park! Multiple gorgeous views from above and FREE parking in the visitor center lot! (If you go down to the Gorge trailhead/picnic area it's $10 I think)
Pro tip: the trail intersects the Gorge Trail so if you’re going to do both, park there instead.   Also, the falls face west so go in the morning for better pictures.
Exceeded expectations
Beautiful. Tough trek back, as either side has some serious stairs to climb. Views are gorges on the South Rim. A bit more tourists on the North Rim, since they can pull up, park, and view the falls.
Loved the hike and views.
Beautiful the fall colors are excellent. I plan on coming back to see all seasons I unless you want  a  up hill climb start down north rim and come up south
Amazing geology! Amazing views! Well maintained trail makes for easy hike except for cardio workout of climbing stairs. Heavily traveled but that's because it's so interesting.
Footpath is easy and stairs down to gorge
Great hike. Went on one of the Labor Day week. Falls water dried up but visible from view point.
Stairs like mad at lake ends. Just easy hike otherwise. Amazing views.
Did North and South Rim and Gorge trails and it was awesome! Not difficult at all and it took a little less than two and a half hours. Definitely recommend!
Beautiful views especially on the North Rim trail. Would have been better in the spring with more water coming over the falls but still a good hike
Beautiful trail with incredible views. I recommend including the 1.5 mile up and back to walk to the waterfall.
it was not bad. nothing special.

easy path to follow, gorgeous views, especially of taughannock falls on north rim. a bit of road noise at parts, but mostly peaceful and quiet. lots of stairs at the beginning / end of loop, but most of the actual path is fairly flat.  no crowding at all!

Awesome hike. Well worth it.  Start from the lake, take the entrance with the arch and climb from there. The hike is challenging due to the steep steps - the trail itself is very well maintained. Several nice viewpoints along the way but a lot of trees tend to block the best views.
very nice hike!
Clear. Fall was pretty dry.

Trail was just ok. Good elevation at the beginning if you like that (which I do). The waterfall was cool (although not a lot of water right now) but you can also just drive to the viewing point on the north rim - or do the gorge trail for best views.
Nice trail that is well maintained. Completed with 5 and 8 year old boys and a dog
Amazing what 380 million years will do to our earth.  People are good about wearing mask & keeping 6' apart.  BTW, North rim is mostly up hill.  Bring water.
We went on May 13th. We didn’t get to do the gorge because it was closed at the time. But the rim trails were awesome!! Recommend it to all. We need to go back to do the gorge trail.

Great trail. Amazing views. Took opposite route and started at the base by the lake on the south trail and returned via the north trail. $8 for parking. Hundreds were on the gorge trail but only 40-50 people on the rim trail.
Not too crowded on the upper trails, nice summer hike
Amazing  Moderate because  There were some parts Where It was straight incline  Even though it wasn’t t bad at all  I’ll be back

We started at the bottom in the lake parking lot, went up the South Rim trail & came down North Rim trail. Trail is well marked. I’ve done the Gorge Trail several times so it was great to get a different perspective of the falls. Steep stairs at the start, but levels out after that.
Best hiking trails, well groomed and clearly marked. Excellent hiking experience with my two dogs and my two sons-3 and 10 years old.

There are a lot more people situated near the water at the entrance. You can walk over and walk in the water. The loop was fun! There were great views and everything is well labeled. The stairs can be a little steep but you only have to worry about them at the beginning/end of the north and south rim trail.

The streps were steep but you get some beautiful views of the falls and the lake from way up high!  The main parking lot has cones in every other spot to promote social distancing so get here early if you want to park at the State Park lot.

beautiful views from a well maintained trail. started up the south rim, and there's a bunch of stairs. looks like there's an alternate route for the descent of the north rim that avoids stairs, which we will take next time. it levels out pretty quickly.  took us 2 hours, but I weigh close to 400lbs and my hiking buddy/wife is getting a total hip replacement next month. for people of size or with joint issues, a set of walking sticks might make all the difference between an enjoyable hike or abject agony. we can't wait to walk it again
nice. easy lots of stairs. so enjoyable. a must. takes about 2 hours with small kids

Despite the closure, this trail is still worth visiting. The experience of viewing the gorge from so high up and from so many angles is an unbearably unique experience. Would recommend going the North Rim way around towards the Falls Overlook Center, as the South Rim is closed about halfway in.
Definitely easy trail. A lot of the trails that were close
Heavy traffic, close to the road. But the views are amazing, took an hour and a half to do the round trip started on the south rim
Fun and easy 3 mile hike. Some cool views and nice kept trail. Took 1 hour to finish

One of my favorite trails in the Finger Lakes. The views are terrific, it’s well maintained, it has two (two!) real bathrooms. It is mostly shaded. And the falls themselves are amazing, but so is the gorge both above and below, as well as the hints of Cayuga Lake through the trees!!  What more could you ask for??!!  Thank you NY state for maintaining and improving this trail over the years!!

5 star views, 3 star trail. The landscape around the waterfall and cascades is spectacular, however the trail itself is next to a road for most of the way. The trail itself is in good condition and an easy, rather than moderate walk, despite the elevation.
We hiked the south rim trail to the North rim trail.  Several steps at the beginning but a lot of level trail as well.  Excellent views of the waterfall from above.
Really enjoyed this walk! Beautiful gorge with a leisurely stroll.
Nice, easy trail along the rim. There's a 400 foot climb/descent, but otherwise, it's pretty casual.
Overcrowded and way too urban. North rim wasn’t bad, but made the mistake of going into the Gorge Trail with 10,000 of my closest friends. Beautiful falls, but a Sunday stroll, not a hike.
Beautiful view of the falls.Even saw an eagle.
Did only a short part of this trail. Maybe in the future, I'd like to go back to do the whole thing.
South rim seemed overall less steep.  Gorgeous views all the way around.

This was a amazing hike with gorgeous sight and views of the gorge and falls. It took me about two hours to do the whole rim trail, starting and ending at the overlook. It was about 3.2 miles total, but I had forgotten to turn off the recording before driving back down to the gorge entrance. It is tough and tiring towards the bottom going up either direction due to many steep steps and inclined to have to climb, but it was definitely worth it! I’ll be back for sure
Great hike with dogs. Good altitude gain and beautiful waterfalls.
Wonderful waterfalls. Highly recommend follow the South and North Rim Trail .i love it .
Beautiful easy and scenic
Started at the bottom and went up the south rim.  Steps weren’t bad at all!  Beautiful views, well marked trail. Overall a fun hike!
Hiked the start of the north rim in the campground and walked around. Great day for a hike!
Love this trail - did this with 3 dogs in August. It was hot and the stairs are killer but will do this again!
This trail is gorge-ous
Hopefully this will be one of many.

We recommend the South Trail, North Rim Trail then the Falls Trail as well. Lots of great views, hot today so we took a lot of water. Lots of areas to sit and rest. Watch the heat folks! There is a lot of shade.
Great views of the gorge and very shaded for hot days.

Hiked the rim trails and the gorge trail on one of the hottest days of the year. Today, the rim trails were not very busy. I recommended starting with the South Rim, then the North Rim and end with the Gorge trail.

Taughannock Rim trail.  While the gorge trail is spectacular, this was the hike I was looking for to get a workout. Yes, it's rated as moderate, but the steps going up (and then coming back down) will challenge those small muscles above your knees! It was a bit disorienting when emerging at the overlook from way above - I wasn't sure where the rim trail picked back up (no signage until you get much closer) but I figured it out - just keep along rim :) A great hike around the gorge, for sure.

While the gorge trail is spectacular, this was the hike I was looking for to get a workout.  Yes, it's rated as moderate, but the steps going up (and then coming back down) will challenge those small muscles above your knees! It was a bit disorienting when emerging at the overlook from way above - I wasn't sure where the rim trail picked back up (no signage until you get much closer) but I figured it out - just keep along rim :)  A great hike around the gorge, for sure.
Did the South Rim Trail to the Gorge. Good sights from above into the gorge, but inside the gorge is way better.
Beautiful trail! The gorge trail is a necessary addition in my opinion!

Nice long round trip. Added the gorge trail to make the total trip close to 5 Miles. This park is a great mix of good hiking, great views of the gorge and falls, and some touristy park areas if you want to hang out for the day, picnic, swim, etc.  The hardest part is the steps in either direction on the east side as you ascend to the rim. The rest is relatively flat.

Absolutely loved the hike. I just wish I knew what I had gotten myself into originally. Turns out there is a road through the park that will take you down to the base of the waterfall. I started at the top around the Rim and found myself hiking down and THEN traversing across towards the base of the waterfall. Won’t make that mistake twice...
Good for those that want the views as well as a more moderate hike
Fun sight seeing hike with amazing view points of the highest waterfall in NY.
Beautiful trail. Nice views of the gorge and waterfall. Part of it was closed but there was an alternate route so it was okay!
We went halfway through the trail and saw it was closed so we continued on the side of the street. I was pretty bummed we couldn't do the whole thing.
An absolutely beautiful trail that gives you a great look at the gorges and the falls below.  One of my favorite trails!
Tried hiking the south rim. It was icy, but not bad with micro spikes. It was closed one mile in. So I did part of the north rim. Decent view of the falls. Not too crowded.
totally awesome even in November.

It’s definitely a decent hike. We started on the North Rim, went to the Gorge Trail. We hiked back up through the Sound Rim trail back to the car. 5.2 miles in total. The views are amazing and there are most definitely smaller and more exciting trails to take.
We did the rim trail and then the falls. Beautiful late summer hike, mid 70's, still good water flow over the falls. 5 miles, 2 hours, 1,063 elevation change. One of our favorites!

Buttermilk Falls Gorge Trail.Name: Buttermilk Falls Gorge Trail
Buttermilk Falls Gorge Trail.Description: Buttermilk Creek drops 600 feet as it plunges through a gorge down the eastern slope of the Cayuga Valley at the southernmost edge of the City of Ithaca. Five trails in the park wander through a remarkable variety of landscapes.

parking lot: NY-13 S/NY-34 S/NY-96 S/Elmira Rd, 3 miles south of Ithaca (Lower/Main Park Trailhead).

More Info: Part of interconnected trail system: Yes
Use of firearms for deer hunting is not allowed. Bow hunting may be allowed. BE SAFE: See the specific trail owner/steward’s website for the most up to date details

Reviews.comment: Gorge trail was closed not sure why it was a beautiful 60 degrees sun was shining type of day. Still did the ridge trail which was nice and very peaceful.
Gorge trail was closed due to ice
Gorge trail is closed. Beautiful hike! Around 2 miles total.
It was absolutely amazing. It was so sad that we couldn’t go to the gorge trail. It was ok though. The waterfall was beautiful. It wasn’t that bad for my 4 children.
perfect hike

3/26 - Gorge trail is still closed but the Rim trail still has some views worth checking out. The falls is flowing very nicely. I can only imagine how beautiful it would be up close on the Gorge side, will need to come back later in the year!
Gorge trail closed so we were only able to do the rim trail. The rim trail is a constant uphill climb
Beautiful

Only hiked half of the trail the Gorges trail was closed because of ice. It looks like it would be a beautiful hike If you got to walk along the falls. The rim part of the hike was alright. Maybe give it a month so you can hike the whole thing.
Very icy in some spots, well traveled trail along with a lot of mud. Descending towards the gorges bottom is closed due to ice and sliding snow fall dangers.
Such a great hike!! Half of the trail was closed due to ice but it was still worth seeing half of it!
Gorge trail is closed for the season but the Rim Trail is still open.
Gorge trail was awesome, rim trail was boring
Gorge Trail is closed for the season
Great bathroom beautiful falls and trails! Very organized for Covid
Holy incline!
Love this trail. Hike up rim trail is steep and rough, but gorge trail down is some of the best hiking I’ve ever done
Gorgeous! Nature at its best! Definitely got my heart rate up at certain ascents but super happy we hiked this one as the gorge is amazing!!!
Gorgeous but definitely strenuous on the uphill part! Watch footing as the leaves make it slippery this time of year! Some didn’t seem to get the “one way” memo but still a beautiful hike!
Great loop! Strenuous on the way back up for about 1/2 the trail. Lovely gorge.
Rim trail up, gorge trail down. Beautiful waterfalls!!
Beautiful!! Great trails with great views
Very pretty
Gorgeous fall colors
Beautiful hike (not as pretty as Treman, but shorter + easier). Park did a great job with plenty of signs about the one-way trail and wearing masks, pity half the people here ignore them.

The light a couple hours after sunrise as the sunbeams hit the spray in the gorge is unbelievable.  For anyone looking to make a shorter hike, would recommend starting from the Upper Falls parking lot and taking the Gorge Trail - walk out of the parking lot, take a left on the road and it’s right there on your right. Nice easy stroll to the Upper falls. Taking the Rim trail from the Upper parking lot is a little boring. Not much to see.

Not crowded on weekday mid-morning. The main falls are not impressive at the moment. The much better stuff you need to hike to!  Nothing to see on rim trail and it’s 400 ft elevation gain in first .5 miles. Must go this way to come back down the gorge trail which was beautiful and well worth the trip up. A bunch of waterfalls, pools & rock formations while strolling on a mostly even paved surface with stairs.
Beautiful and dramatic. Easy trail climb up.. Lots of stone steps on the way down. A lot of bang for the buck.
good bit of uphill and steep downhill but amazing view of the gorge
Spectacular short hike with novel scenery of the creek cut outs and falls.
Absolutely beautiful, I highly recommend
Great views and change in terrain. Some exertion on uphill
Beautiful
Best time to hike , when it rains ... it’s awesome !

Did a quick hike around 3:30 and it was nice and not crowded for a Thursday afternoon. The rim trail is a nice uphill portion that is mainly on a dirt and rocks. The gorge trail is downhill mainly with on stairs. As stated, it is a one way loop ascending via the rim and descending via the gorge. There are signs indicating a one way route but there are still people who unfortunately don’t follow the rule. Everyone did wear masks and face coverings though so it wasn’t too bad. The trail itself was very nice but it’s pretty late in the season so the gorge itself was filled with leaves from all the trees.
First half mile gets your heart pumping and the walk back down the gorge is beautiful!
Moderate trail. Nice scenery.
Stunning cascades and peak autumn colors mid-Oct. Wet stones can be slippery on descent.
Great hike not to crowded colors great
Always beautiful here. Best to go during a rainy season or after heavy rain to see a spectacular waterfall.
Beautiful! Worth the fee to enter.

Rim Trail 3/5  Gorge Trail Loop 5/5  Unfortunately they had it going 1 way starting with the Rim Trail, which left you looking over your shoulder the whole time you were going down the Gorge Trail. To make matters worse, there’s a shortcut about halfway without a trail marker and a majority of people were going in the opposite direction anyway

Absolutely brilliant hike, not too busy and everyone seemed to be observing the protocols in terms of masks and distancing.  The hike itself was well sign posted and the restrooms were very clean.  All in all a beautiful hike that I would completely recommend to anyone staying at Firelight!
Awesome
Gorgeous. Fall colors and low water made for a placid and serene stroll.
$8 to park. Beautiful. Moderately trafficked but everyone was respectful.
Stay left at "Y" in road. Right is only the 1/2 way trail. Top 1/2 of trail is best.
Paid $8 for parking. No water in waterfall. Boo. Didnt bother with hike
Falls are dry but a beautiful hike. Rim trail is fairly steep climb up.
This rim and gorge trail loop was a good hike to a 960 foot elevation. The trail meanders along a naturally carved gorge. Scenic and pretty.
Well maintained. A bit of an incline at the beginning of the rim trail, but relatively flat the rest of the way

Haven’t learned my lesson yet. Too many people here who cannot or will not follow the one-way signs, and refuse to wear a mask. Not a fan of these people.   Also too much road noise.   Basically “get off my lawn”
easy level trail
great hike. awesome falls!
Beautiful scenery and waterfalls but not much water falling. Dry spell.
Pretty steep climb on starting from rim trail but over all nice forest and stream view.
Awesome loop
Nice hike. Would recommend
Loved it! The waterline is a little low this time of year but still got to see the falls

the nature is beautiful.  A lot of climbing up AND down. was somewhat difficult and especially anyone with knee issues. peaceful falls but a lot of people ! people also unable to follow the "one way" directions... it's actually the worst behaved crowd I've seen on a trail.  people jumping off cliffs into the pools where there are many signs that say no swimming.  climbing out in very dangerous areas as well..  overall, enjoyed the hike !
beautiful walk around the gorge. a little dangerous at times so be mindful!

Way up in worst segment equivalent of four flights of stairs. Altogether easy. More people than at Destiny the day before. Disheveled gravel path. Dirty. Majority of people not wearing masks. Trash on right, trash on left. Weekend flipflopped daredevils galore taking ownership of the picture at every corner.
People on trail don’t pay attention to one way signs
Nice short hike
Awesome but little hard
Easy but a great trail!
Overcrowded
Great trail! Very pretty!
It was great though covid makes things a bit less relaxing. Some folks wore masks others just didn’t care. Water was low but duh it’s summer. Nice hike. Steep first few meters
Great trail!  Wear good footwear!  Slate is slippery when wet!

we hiked this on a Sunday afternoon. while the weather was beautiful, it was extremely disappointing coming down the gorge trail to find so many people standing around playing loud music, not socially distant and not wearing masks. part of the trail is narrow, so hard to get by. and not to mention people were in the water when there are clearly signs that say no swimming and keep out. not sure if it's like that all the time, but won't recommend this to friends because of that.
Took Rim Trail to Gorge Trail. First 1/3 is steep, but doable. Even with very low water, it was still beautiful!

Went on a Tuesday after 5pm, it wasn't overly crowded. Even though it stated one way, no one followed that. This path is very steep.Not much water flowing from the falls but it was cool to see. Parking was $8 but machine would not give change Bathrooms were nice. Swimming section was closed.

The scenery is amazing, especially the gorge trail. Much less amazing are the masses of people who ignore the one way, mask required, and no swimming signs. Hiking with two kids (3&5), it’s quite difficult to explain why we are following the rules and others are blatantly ignoring them. But that aside, it’s a great hike. Just bring your mask, hike the right way, and stay out of the water.

The trail is one way right now because of Covid 19 so you are supposed to go up the Rim Trail then connect and go down the Gorge Trail. I started up the Rim Trail and gave up on it pretty quickly. It was SUPER crowded (on a Monday afternoon) and like 90% of the people were not wearing masks even though the trail is very narrow so most of the people were not socially distanced. The trail so also very very steep. I would not call it moderate (maybe on the way down). I walked over and looked at the waterfall from the bottom near the swimming area and it didn't have much water right now,  but it was I pretty and I'm sure is much more impressive when conditions aren't so dry.  The swimming area was closed (I was told due to lack of lifeguards)

Great hike! The way up was a steady steep incline that gave us a good workout. Coming down was smooth and steps. The views of the falls were beautiful even though there wasn’t a lot of water right now. The trail wasn’t too crowded at 9am. Swimming at the bottom was closed.

The trail is great and well maintained. There are lots of stairs!! The only reason I didn’t give it 5 stars was because most of the bathrooms in the park are closed and they are still taking $8 a car to get into the park. Get there early.
Absolutely amazing!
We went at 7 am and only saw two other people! It took us an hour to do the whole loop. The water is low right now but it’s still beautiful!
Really pretty. The connection between end of Rim trail and the Gorge trail it is a little confusing, but other than that its pretty straight forward.
One of my favorites! Honestly think it tops Taughannock State Park!
Magical pools
No water- everything was dried up. We somehow ended up off the trail and in the woods where we found deer and turkeys.   The trail requires you to cross roads which was strange.

Their is a $8 parking fee and their is a swimming area but unfortunately it wasn’t open today because lifeguards were not there. You’re not supposed to swim in the gorge but I seen a lot of people swimming and even jumping into the deeper parts of the water.
Definitely a challenge for about a mile going up the rim trail, but so worth the views heading down. Too many people for my liking but that's to be expected in the summertime. Also pet friendly.
Super crowded. Mostly filled with tourons!!!

Best hiking during my trip in finger lakes. The gorge is beautiful!  Few places you could stay in the water but the swimming pool is closed on the day I visited.  95% People wear masks. Per COVID, it is one way hike but 10% people walk in their own way. Freedom?！ Recommend to all.
Nice place to hike and swim.  Pretty busy and people not paying attention to the one way track or mask wearing.
Great to hike in early morning before it gets too busy.
Really pretty backdrops all over, shaded well!

Rim Trail was very hard. Didn’t know you could opt out and just do the gorge trail. Would definitely do the gorge trail again as it was very beautiful and would definitely bring a bathing suit! A little disappointed that there was hardly any water running down the main falls at the entrance otherwise would have given 5 stars.
Beware of moderate crowds
Awesome waterfalls
Very nice. If going into the water go in the middle or the top. The pool at the bottom is full of people and kids.

Tough Rim trail getting up, but worth every bit of it. Gorgeous on the way down. Don't take the bridge go all the way to the road and make a right and another right  onto the Gorge trail to come back! Nice spots to jump in the water!
Strenuous hike up but lots of falls n swimming holes.
One way trail but doesn’t matter too much. Hard going up but wasn’t too bad. Great views all the way back through the gorge. Pool time once we hit the end *cannonbaaaalllll*

Wow. You gain 900’ elevation on the Rim Trail side, up a combination of hills, rocks, and roots made into steps, and then the Gorge Trail takes you down mostly stairs. It feels MUCH longer than 1.6 mi.!  FYI: The Gorge Trail side is rated Hard, not Moderate.   It’s definitely hard on the knees, but SO beautiful! Very well-kept trail and easy to follow. The way down/back is narrow at places and it is hard to socially distance. There are plenty of places to swim and marvel at the towering walls of stone on the way down.

One way up rim and down gorge trail. Did bear add on. Gorgeous views on gorge trail, started at 8:15 am and barely passed any people - maybe 4-5 groups in wrong direction? Liked way better than Watkins glen and had waterfall views to myself for a while.
Drove 6 hours to kick my hike off with this sight. Told me I couldn’t hit the trail because of Covid.... our doors.... Covid outdoors.
A great way to start the day.
Great intermediate trail! The gorge trail side has stairs, the rim trail side does not. Open during COVID, but it’s all one-way on the loop. A little more crowded than expected, but still beautiful!
Great trail for a couple hour walk! Steep hike on the way up and there are several falls on the way down with an easy walk on the way down. The swimming hole was closed due to COVID.

7/22/2020 From the upper lot. The Gorge is one way to the Lower Lot, Rim is one way back up.  Rim is pretty steep for the first half, not brutal but not that easy either, but it does even off.  Gorge trail is gorgeous, rim trail doesn't really provide a view.

Great hike, but just a heads up...swimming is not allowed on the trail, (even though you see lots of people swimming) and they are ticketing people (we were ticketed for swimming). Totally worth it though! Lots of stairs, but beautiful views!

For a photo map, parking location, and trail recording, go to https://www.alltrails.com/explore/recording/buttermilk-falls-gorge-and-rim-trail-loop-649d45b From where I parked, I walked up Rim Trail to where it meets a road (W. King Rd), walked along the shoulder of the road for about twenty feet, and walked Gorge Trail back down. Buttermilk Falls is unique in the sense that there are numerous round holes carved into the creekbed, making for awesome natural swimming pools. I saw several people swimming in these pools along my hike. I assume each of these holes were carved out hundreds/thousands of years ago when a large waterfall was at it's location, pouring thousands of gallons of water onto one spot from high above, acting like a drill, and creating a round hole. Just like getting a bucket of water, and pouring it onto dirt in one spot, creating a round hole. At one point, there is a large stone pillar right in the middle of the gorge, where water carved out the earth on either side, but leaving it to stand (see it in my pictures at the link above).  All of this is totally fascinating when you think about it!! The power and artistry of Mother Nature at her best!! The trail is very well maintained and developed, with handmade staircases and walkways built in as needed. Definitely a trail worth putting on your must-do list. May you always find peace in the scent of fresh air, in the way breeze feels against your skin, in the glistening reflection of a splashing creek, and in the sound of wind in the trees. Stay humble. Stay kind. Stay thankful. Keep hope. Keep smiling. Keep laughing. Love and respect nature, because that is where you will find a true lifetime of happiness! Also love and respect everyone who crosses your path. There is a reason why they did. If I see you on the trail, I promise to say "Hi" :-)
Amazing hike! Steep at the beginning and end. So many beautiful waterfalls and lots of spots to cool off in the water.

Great trail with beautiful waterfalls. It was extremely crowded, even at 9:30, and the downside was that people were not following the rules and were entering the closed Gorge Trail  (you are supposed to enter the rim trail so that everyone goes one way on the trail due to COVID.) Many people were not wearing masks and did not put on a mask when social distancing was impossible (which it is, due to high volumes of people and narrow trails.) I would only return if it was early on a week day.

Very nice hike. Beginning is a little difficult as it’s all up hill but after that it’s amazing. Beautiful rock formations and falls that you can swim in. We seen a few people jumping off the rocks and that was pretty cool. I really enjoyed this place. Maybe my favorite in the area. Also has a little swimming area at the bottom that wasn’t too crowded.

Great little hike. Strenuous at the beginning but only about a half mile and then it’s easy. Lots of falls and pools to see and swim/wade in. Water is cooooolllddd though, 63F today (July 14th)! One way only trail and shortened due to COVID-19 but worth the $8.
amazing gorge and falls

One of the coolest hikes I’ve ever done. But I will warn that it’s incredibly steep and could prove to be difficult for anybody out of shape (me). The falls were beautiful. We were able to swim a bit as well. 100% worth it!

We went up the rim trail and came back down the gorge trail as the signs requested. Man, it is a steep way up if you’re not in solid shape after quarantine. However the trek down the gorge trail is nice, but a lot of uneven steps so you have to pay attention. Definitely spots to get in the water.
Crowded but beautiful!
Awesome trail. Moderate nearly 5 mi trail with incline, woods and gorgeous falls.
It’s beautiful.
Best trail I’ve done in a while...short, full of perfect spots for swimming in the river. Lots of stairs.
Really loved it here. A decent climb on to Rim Trail leading to the payoff on the Gorge trail. A few spots you could walk right in definitely adds to the experience. Highly recommended.
Loved this trail. Beautiful waterfall. Perfect for all families!
Beautiful trail the whole family can enjoy. Bring water shoes and change of clothes
Beautiful trail. Basically straight up threw the woods and then descending amidst Watkins Glen type falls. Bring your camera.
Moderate, trails in good shape. Water levels was low but enough to cool your feet off and if you daring enough jump in to the cold water!  Good for kids and teens.

One way bike due to COVID. Up the rim trail and down the gorge trail, which is the better way to do it anyway. Don’t take the short cut. Great swimming holes at the top of the falls. But it was very crowded on Sunday.
Loved the Gorge Trail with many views and steps. Went through a one way, Rim Trail Loop because of COVID. Pretty steep at first but it got better.
Great and easily accessible train. Because of Covid, it’s now a loop going up the rim and returning on the gorge. Please follow this direction, because you don’t look cool going the opposite way.
Beautiful short but steep hike with multiple waterfalls and pools. Slippery in places. Facilities and swimming area are currently closed. $8 parking fee.

So I guess the trails are one way only right now? It was my first time doing this hike so I didn’t know where to start exactly and I missed one end completely. Very beautiful views though and lots of critters.

Awesome trails with spectacular scenery. If you come here, be sure to follow park rules and hike up the rim trail and down the gorge trail. The hike is short at only 1.5 miles but it can be made even shorter by crossing the bridge at the half-mile mark.

The gorge trail is still closed.  The rim trail is a great hike and quite the uphill battle if you go all the way down and back up. I included the bear tail in my hike and I will say it was worth it. It has a tiny waterfall over a bridge plus you can see the water. It is only 3/4 of a mile one way.
Beautiful. Gorge trail closed. Come early or park is at full capacity.
Gorge trail is still closed and it’s hard to see the falls from the rim trail, but totally worth the walk! A mile to the end of rim and a mile back
so blessed to live under 5 hours from this hike! SO BEAUTIFUL

it took everything to get my 10 year old son to finish, as it's pretty steep. the gorge trail is closed. that being said, it's beautiful and not crowded on weekdays. also, not muddy, which was nice. a fun hike, but I wish they had some benches along the way for people of my size.
Day of the Dead

Finally able to complete the loop around Lake Treman. Water was low enough and there was a log wedged against the crumbling bridge but sturdy enough to walk across. Quite a few people hiking today. Many w masks. Some not
Gorgeous trail. Part of it was closed so I hiked up the left side of the falls and it went all the way to the second park and up to the Lake Truman trail. It was absolutely stunning.

You could not ask for something more beautiful than what these falls have to offer. Whether you prefer to keep your distance or get to the edge of the water you will not find anything better. I recommend hiking the trail up along the falls first to see them from above before coming across and finishing your hike down next to them
we walked in the river as we hiked up. so fun. just very easy. my kids loved it
George Trail is closed so we went to Rim Trail. It was a nice trail.
Rim trail and bear trail
Took the rim trail out and back. Beautiful trail, well marked and great views of the waterfall along the rim trail. Gorge trail was closed as of now due to construction and safety.

I was only able to go to the area from the parking lot. There was a light dusting of snow over the sheet of ice on the ground, which made my crampons useless and made the walk extremely slippery. I did not attempt to hike the trails, as the stairs were completely covered in snow/ice.
First half was opened but once you reach the bridge, the steps and path leading downhill next to the water is closed. Still great, just doubled back the way we came.
Fun and interesting hike late evening and early night on a very warm Jan2020 weekend
Great winter hike
the falls were beautiful! The gorge trail was closed due to hazardous conditions though...

Another great hike at Buttermilk!! The smell of fall in the air!! You have to watch your step, lots of acorns under the leaves, and the leaves are hiding some roots.  The wife went down today, first time in over 25 years, even the hiking sticks couldn’t save her!

After not being able to find another trail, this was the runner up. Kind of a last minute decision, but enjoyable nonetheless. Little busy in some spots, as one would expect with many families trekking out; uderstandable. The $8 parking was another drawback.
Beautiful trail on a beautiful day. We walked  the gorge trail there and back finding that gorge trails are more scenic.

Gorge trail is phenomenal. Earned the 5 stars. It is short but beautiful and scenic throughout. It was a waterfall that kept going on and on. Highly recommend it. We took Rim on the way back and it was just okay. Maybe a 3 and on the easy side.
natural beauty!! i cant say enough about the beauty. the gorge trails pictures cant show its true beauty. if i could i would give this place a 10 star!! absolutely love it!!

We visited today - a Thursday. As per other reviews, we parked at the top and walked down the Gorge trail, and then back up the Rim trail, and I would definitely recommend that others do this too. The Gorge trail has the stairs at the bottom, and I would far rather walk down than up the stairs. The Rim trail has a steep ascent at the lower end, but I'd rather walk up than down the loose-ish trail. I would definitely do it this way again, but there were people doing it the other way too. It was not too busy, but not deserted either, and swimming was closed. We did not have to pay to park at the top, which was a bonus. I'd say this loop took us an hour and a half, stopping often to take pictures or just enjoy the view.

The gorge trail is very steep so be prepared for that but it is beautiful the entire way! I would recommend coming back on the gorge trail.  the rim trail is through the woods so there is nothing to see.
Next to Lucifer Falls, this is my favorite! The trail it’s a bit dangerous especially since we came after a bit of rain. I highly recommend this breath taking park. A must!

my second favorite hike in the area. I usually do this short loop in 1-1.5 hrs (at a moderate pace with lots of stops to enjoy the view). Wear shoes with good grip as the wet steps do get slippery. I recommend going up the gorge trail and down the rim trail for the best views.
Great trail!  Rim trail was okay not a lot to see and a lot of down hill! Next time I go, I will come back down the gorge trail!  Over all awesome!

Beautiful, gorgeous trail! The trail follows the stream of waterfalls all the way up. Lots of shade. Crowded, but less people the further up you go! Make sure to grab a map, the paths are not as well marked as others.

This is a lovely trail with plenty of shade.  It was a little muddy, but that's to be expected after so much rain.  The Gorge Trail, Rim Trail, Bear Trail, and Lake Treman Trail were all worth the trip. I didn't try the Larch Meadows Nature Trail yet, so that will have to wait for a return trip.  Buttermilk Falls and the Buttermilk Gorge itself were great, but so was the view of the dappled sun through the trees and the wildflowers in bloom.
Beautiful view of the falls, but very crowded.

hiked 6/9/19 we went up the rim trail first and it was quite a work out due to the constant grade increase but after about 10 minutes of it, it levels out, the views are okay from the rim, alot of tree obstruction. we finished by taking the gorge trail and it was well worth it, strolling alot and enjoying the view and taking our time down the steps, some can be slippery so mind your footing. also I recommend doing this trail during the week as it gets busy with people on the weekends. we also brought our lab along who absolutely loved it!
Loved this trail, though I went on a weekday before summer so avoided the crowds. Such gorgeous falls and also came upon a beautiful patch of trillium in the woods.
A beautiful spot with a hike along the gorges. Very crowded on the weekend, and very steep at times. Worth the trek for sure though.
