This is a fun, short trail offering some pretty waterfall views. A quick in and out, and great for kids and dogs.
lots of fun! great waterfall views entire walk through the gorge. rim trail not as exciting, glad it opened up the day we went.
great waterfall. come in offseason to avoid crowds
Started at top of Gorge trail going downhill. Rested at bottom of falls, then crossing bridge, continued hike at the bottom of Rim trail going upward back to the top of both Gorge and Rim trail.
So many waterfalls! And as many stairs to match. Great way to kickstart the heart.
Waterfalls were very full & trails are in great condition.
So pretty, wonderful nature hike!! Beautiful falls!
even in early November its a nice place to visit. lots a waterfalls around this area. do some searching on the net so you don't miss any. you can spend a weekend or week here and see a lot in Ithaca.

Robert H. Treman Gorge Trail.Name: Robert H. Treman Gorge Trail

parking lot: NY 13, 5 miles south of Ithaca, on NY 327. Lower park entrance is first and upper park entrance is further along NY 327.

More Info: Part of interconnected trail system: Yes
Use of firearms for deer hunting is not allowed. Bow hunting may be allowed. BE SAFE: See the specific trail owner/steward’s website for the most up to date details

Reviews.comment: Alot of folks.. busy
Its so beautiful and peaceful.
Great trail. Gorge Trail is still closed, but the Rim Trail is a good out and back route. Several good views of waterfalls. Good amount of stairs and inclines.
Beautiful trail. The Gorge trail side is closed, but the rim trail is open. There was very minimal snow and ice, so I imagine by the time I write this it was already all gone.

Really a great hike. Somewhat strenuous and a great workout - worth it for the stunning views of the waterfalls.  Only downside is conditions were icy in March and slippery in some places and half of the trail was closed. Otherwise on a warmer sunny I’d imagine it’s even better.
Super cool trail!! Really pretty in the winter but bummer the other part of the trail is closed. Might be worth it to even come back in the spring to check out the rest of the trail.
great hike but limited route because of winter. gorge trail is closed and rim trail only goes to stairs 2 miles in
Along with Lucifer Falls this is one of the best trails and hikes we have ever done. I saw scenery that blew my mind. An absolute must.
Some places were a bit slippery due to ice. Also the trim trail, if you start at the lower falls, doesn’t go further than the bottom of Lucifer falls. The gorge trail is closed entirely.
Pretty in the snow. The final part of the trail with steps up to the falls is closed, but still a great hike.
gorgeous
Good except gorge trail is closed
Gorge trail is closed.
Went in November on a day with light snow. Great view of lucifer falls from both sides of the loop.

Beautiful trail but always busy, especially on the upper side around the mill and the falls. I like to take out of town guests here. The stairs kick butt, even for experienced hikers. Nice view at the top. The waterfall is stunning.
This trail was well worth it, amazing views throughout the hike even in the off season. Waterfalls were still flowing.  Would do again in a heartbeat
great hike. super well marked. a few steep climbs and descents. awesome views especially at the top of the mountain near the end of the rim trail and the start of gorge.
trails still one-way, up Rim, down Gorge. lightly trafficked later in the season, good views, elevations, stairs, can get muddy in spots.

We parked at the Gorge entrance and went down the gorge and up the rim trail. One way was nice because you don’t really run into anyone! On a Misty Monday is was blissfully uncrowded. Lots of stairs and stares, at the gorges waterfalls!!! I will be back!

Lovely trail, not terribly difficult but hard enough to make my ten year complain.  Lots of beautiful sights to be seen.  Make sure to hike all the way to the top, it’s worth the climb.  Beware of lots of young people without masks slippery wooden steps and Trump supporters too.
Lots of well-kept stairs. Beautiful views of gorge and waterfall. Bit crowded, but not terrible. Trails are currently one way due to COVID.
Awesome trails.  It is pretty intense especially going up the stone steps.  Highly recommend.  Can get very crowded on weekends though.

Got there at 9 AM on a weekday and only saw a few other people the whole time! It was raining, but there’s good tree cover for all but the part at the gorge. Tons of stairs, but the view is worth it. Love how clear the signs are about going one direction (though several people were going the wrong way anyway).

Great autumn hike!! If you don't want to do the full loop, start from the upper entrance (west) and you can go out on the Gorge Trail and then cross the bridge to the rim trail. You'll get a great view of the upper falls from both trails! We did the whole loop and enjoyed the whole thing, but if you just want the big falls, that small loop would be great.
Busy busy busy today

Such a beautiful walk. Steep-ish uphill climb at the front end, but nothing extreme or unmanageable. Walking down the path next to the falls is just beautiful.  Lots of leaves in the fall, so watch your step if you take the stone stairs.
Busy with people, but easy walk. Note that there’s a steepish walk on the way back. Beautiful, but waterfalls are pretty dry
The view at the beginning of the upper entrance is one of the best ever!
clean and not too busy. overall great places to stop and look at fall views and dogs loved it!
Very nice.
Breath taking worth your time great colors

Amazingly beautiful!!!! It really took by breath away for a bit.  Just so worth it.  We did the entire loop 4+ miles.  At some points I questioned my life choices but it was so well worth it.  The falls, the views all the cute dogs!!!!!! Just a great day. We got there nice and early and we had hardly anyone around at first, by the time we ended the park was packed.  So get there early to get the best light for pictures and get the area with minimal amount of people. The longer hike was perfect.

Started out at the Rim trail.. It hits you right away with a beautiful waterfall, then you begin your trek towards the Gorge.. There's nothing but some strenuous hiking for a bit, making you wonder if this will get any better than that first fall.. No worries, because IT DOES! The Gorge side of things is absolutely awesome.. Great visuals at basically every turn.. I drove 4 hrs with friends to get here, but it was totally worth it.
Went in the fall. It was beautiful!!! Highly recommend
Really pretty waterfalls! Hike was challenging at times, but overall really great.
Amazing. A nice challenging hike for a beginner like me. Amazing view
Great views on the upper part of the park
Really well marked. Great waterfall views. Would recommend!
Beautiful but too crowded.

Pleasant trail, mostly packed gravel or old asphalt. Nice view of (I think?) Lucifer Falls from the Rim Trail. We went on a Thursday morning and only encountered two other groups, one of which was going the wrong way, but everyone wore masks.
totally awesome!
Beautiful woods and gorge. Well traveled and maintained trail.
I preferred this to Watkins Glen; better views and far less busy. The loop is one-way only due to Covid and people were mostly compliant.
Lovely trail! Bathrooms at top and bottom. Lots of stairs. Saw a few snakes but they were small and minding their own business.
Lots of great falls and scenes!

Great hike! Not too difficult if you take breaks at the stairs. The Gorge Trail is definitely more scenic than the Rim Trail but the very end of Rim (after more stairs!) has a great view of the mountains and sunrise.
beautiful and lots of decline
Good workout. Recorded 5.2 miles for us. Lots of pretty scenery. Wish there was more water at the waterfalls. Hasn’t rained in a while.
Great views
man made, but beautiful gorges
beautiful scenery
Currently covid one way. Some steep uphill  & nice gorges
Big falls big view.  Lots of stairs.  Lots of fun.  Different types of views and falls

The Gorge trail is very pretty with cascading water coursing through deep green Northern woods. The Gorge trail has a handful of climbs but is easy overall. The Rim Trail has fewer views of the water and some endless stairs going up. We liked the whole loop a lot. If you take the Room then make sure everyone can handle a long step climb.
Great hike! Beautiful views and varied terrain. Be prepared for lots of stairs.

The trails were beautiful and well-maintained, and the views were incredible! Worth the climb which can be somewhat steep at times. Due to the pandemic, note that you must begin the hike at the Rim Traihead.  However; we were extremely disappointed and discouraged by the amount of trash that people have left on the trail, particularly bagged dog poop and used masks.  There’s zero excuse, carry out what you carry in!
Big waterfall is beautiful! Tame gorge trail then bridge over to see waterfall from bottom view

Great trail!! Just enough to get your heart rate up and moderate enough to give reprieve along the way. Super well maintained. Very beautiful trail with awesome views of the gorge and falls. Just an FYI... lots of stairs at times.
Amazing!

Beautiful scenic trail. We did the loop twice. The first time we took it pretty slow and stopped a few times for pictures and water and that took us around 2 and a half hours to finish the loop. The second time we power walked the whole loop without stopping and that took 1 hour exactly. Only negative to this hike was the huge crowd of people which made it difficult to pass at multiple parts of trail. Also, if you want to ensure you’ll be able to get in the park get here as early as possible because the park has been reaching full capacity before noon and has to close the entrance. Regardless, this was definitely worth the 2 hour drive from Rochester to see.
Great trail, not too crowded if you start early before 9am. Definitely more people going down the gorge trail for the views
One of the best hikes, I have ever been!!  Best part is that we can walk through the waterfall and river path!
Nice trail, very scenic. Very peaceful and serene hiking along the water and falls. NYS has such beautiful sites
It’s gorges!
Beautiful trail that leads to a gorgeous waterfall. I'm new to hiking & I was able to complete this trail (few stops to catch my breath) but overall a great trail.
Pretty scenic
great trail, very scenic
Awesome one, ranked at the top.. as of today!
Too many people without masks.
Great trail! Good challenging steps at times and beautiful views of the gorge
Very nice trail.
absolutely amazing trail, waterfalls, and hidden swimming spots. 10/10 will be back again.

Well maintained and beautiful loop with swimming and gorgeous water spots. Went during a very dry covid filled summer but still saw people in the water. Appreciate the one way system and saw everyone wearing masks. Except for one a*#!^*e

Great trail! Beautiful views of multiple falls. The stairs in multiple spots were pretty intense. Very enjoyable overall. We started at 9:30 and were the only ones on the trail. By 11:30 it was very crowded and the parking lot was full when we left.
Beautifully paved. The trail was good for cardio. Definitely family friendly. There is a nice spot to eat lunch at Lucifer falls and a nice water hole to jump into

We enjoyed this hike a lot. Since covid we have been trying to get outside and spend more time in nature since it’s the only “normal” activity now. We have two smaller kids (6 and 4) and the rim side was a bit difficult for them, but they managed okay. Beautiful views, and very peaceful. It was a great way to spend the day.
It was awesome
It was gorgeous a little busy but it eventually spaced out. All the water was spectacular!!

I loved this trail.  It was challenging enough to feel like you’d really achieved something but not too much that my kids (5&8) couldn’t cope.  It’s very steep in parts with lots of steps but there is also plenty of flat and down hill.  We parked at the bottom near the swimming section.  Did the trail which took around 2.5hrs, stopping off half way for lunch.  Then ended with a swim in river and jumped off the driving board! Loads of fun.  This is a must do!
upper gorge area was amazing..... trails very well maintained.....most people wore masks and followed the one way trail designations
Excellent! Stone stairs were particularly impressive

Didn’t capture first part of hike. Round trip (starting and ending at parking lot) closer to 6 miles, not the 4.3 alltrails says! And 1100’ elevation gain! Awesome hike though, one of the best I’ve done. Amazing gorges and water falls, lots of variation in terrain.

Fabulous! Favorite hike in area. Stunning views, moderate hike. Stopped at Enfield falls afterwards for a refreshing dip. The only negative is alot of people were going the wrong way on gorge trail with no masks.

One way due to COVID. Beautiful hike going up the rim trail and coming down the gorge trail from the lower parking lot. Enjoyed the gorge views and waterfalls! Some people don’t follow the one way making it harder for everyone!  Thanks to the park for the one way setup and planning! Everyone should follow and respect that!

Great trail. Just one way due to Covid-19. People need to listen and obey the rules. It’s steep and people were going in opposite direction and no mask. Total disregard for others. The swim at the end is all worth the 5 mile hike. Will be back for more
Beautiful trail! Not too crowded got there around 10am

Half of the trail was closed apparently due to dangerous conditions. Arrived here at 9ish and started hiking at 930. Trail was already packed and half the people weren’t wearing face coverings properly. Would recommend getting here at 6 am or avoid.
great trail .lots of stairs wear hiking shoes

One of my favorite hikes in the Ithaca area! We got there after 5pm, we didn't see any other hikers. The trails are one-way now, ascending Rim and descending Gorge. Be prepared for mud, lots of stairs, and steep climbs/descents. The trails are well marked and easy to follow. Great views, great waterfalls!
Excellent hike, the pool at the end was too busy for our NYC Covid-19 sensibilities, but we dipped our legs along the way.
Lots of inclines! Stairs in every direction. Good solid hike. Gorge Trail is one way, so start at rim and loop around that way.
I’m like almost positive this trail is 5 miles and that the 4 number comes from the cutoff which doesn’t include Lucifer Falls. I did not verify this trail so I very well could be wrong.
Such a great workout with perfect views!
Great hike,  amazing views!

For a photo map, parking location, and trail recording, go to https://www.alltrails.com/explore/recording/rim-trail-to-forge-trail-0188251  This trail recording is for Lucifer Falls within the Enfield Glen and is the feature attraction of the Robert H. Treman State Park near Ithaca in the Finger Lakes area.  I parked in the parking lot on Park Rd (restrooms available). I decided to take Rim Trail to hike to the top, which connects to Gorge Trail for the hike back down. Both of these trails are steep, but they are both very well developed, with stone stairs to help your footing in the steepest areas. From the parking lot, it is a short walk on Park Road to the beginning of Rim Trail, which is in the camping area. Rim Trail begins behind Cabin #9. The first set of falls the trail overlooks is Enfield Falls, which is the desiginated swimming area. Very beautiful view. Going up Rim Trail a little further, you come to the base of Lucifer Falls. Looking up at Lucifer Falls is spectacular. Continuing along Rim Trail, the views are very nice. Once you reach the top, you will come to the intersection with Gorge Trail. It is well marked with signs. There is also a parking lot at that point, and there are restrooms at the far end. When you start decending down Gorge Trail, the views are absolutely amazing! There are two things you will see: 1) how powerful water can be in cutting through the rock, creating such a beautiful and magnificent gorge, and 2) how much work and effort was put into creating the staircases and walkways through this gorge. I assume everything was done by hand, along with using mules/horses. Both of these aspects are truly amazing! As you are decending Gorge Trail, you will be on top of Lucifer Falls, looking down into the gorge from above it. The views along this entire trail are inspiring and unforgettable. This is definitely a hiking trail to put on your must-do list.   May you always find peace in the scent of fresh air, in the way breeze feels against your skin, in the glistening reflection of a splashing creek, and in the sound of wind in the trees. Stay humble. Stay kind. Stay thankful. Keep hope. Keep smiling. Keep laughing. Love and respect nature, because that is where you will find a true lifetime of happiness! Also love and respect everyone who crosses your path. There is a reason why they did. If I see you on the trail, I promise to say "Hi" :-)

Awesome trail... some steep parts but not too bad. .25 mile markers along the way show elevation change and how far you are so it’s not a surprise. Great views on both sides of the gorge which was nice. Several safe easy spots to get in and cool off with the kids too.

On 7/13 there was plenty of water!   But the rock was wet and slippery; can't have everything. The rim trail is fairly strenuous, but not difficult.  Not particularly scenic, but pleasant.   The gorge trail is much nicer, though my dog kept trying to get down to the water (but that that is entirely my problem). A few people, not a problem.

Overall, a very fun hike with awesome views throughout. Stopped and took lots of breaks, put feet in the water, and lots of pictures. Fairly busy in July. We went clockwise and there were a good bit of stairs to climb. Just took our time. Would do this again in a heartbeat just for the views and atmosphere.
This trail is filled with lots of Shade. Perfect for a morning hike. Make sure to bring your camera because the views are incredible.

Pretty easy trail. Great views of the gorges. Would recommend for beginners and families with kids. Make sure you jump in the water off the diving board when you’re done! Also, hit up Ithaca Brewing Company afterwards for a tasty beverage!
Amazing hike! Lots of waterfalls, especially on the gorge trail. Pretty packed on a Friday afternoon in July.

Trail must be taken in reverse - the park only allows visitors to enter from the Rim Trail side and then exit from the Gorge trail in order to minimize visitors overlapping to help with social distancing  conditions were good as of July 6 - water level is low but still fun, a little bit of trail maintenance about 1/2 mile from Gorge trail exit (stairway is being rebuilt), parking lot and swimming hole limited to half capacity to help with distancing

A great, strenuous hike! My map started recording late, but we started at Buttermilk falls entrance, took Rim to Bear to the loop around the Lake and the Gorge back. Lots of inclines but worth it. Bear trail is the best part to me, deep woods, quiet, and the air feels so fresh and pure. Four stars only because the lake was dried out at the top, and we saw a dead fish and crayfish...curious! Everyone was jumping in the falls on the way back so we did too, omg the water was pure heaven! Beautiful day, highly recommend!

AMAZING hike we started at the lower falls and worked our way up the river until we got to the upper falls parking lot. We looped onto the gorge trail and got to walk along the bottom of the falls and take a dip in the refreshing waters. BEST hike
One of my favorites! Beautiful views and many places to swim! Amazed with how many waterfalls we could see!
Beautiful view. There are steep rock stairs that lead to a high up view that is great. Definitely a moderate trail, but there are lots of places to take breaks.

Lovely hike! We arrived at 8:30 am, parked at the lower entrance, and hiked up the Rim trail and down the Gorge trail.  If you have bad knees, the trail might not be for you!  There are some inclined areas and stairs.  We have a 7 and 9 year old and they did okay but it was helpful to stop and take some breaks wading in the water and they loved that.  It was a very pretty hike.  We liked that there are signs that say how far you hiked and the incline.  The only down sides were the bathrooms were not open so we had to go in the woods.  We didn't check the ones near the cabins, though.  The mill was closed also.

Pretty much perfection.  One of my favorite hikes ever and surpasses Breakneck as my favorite in NY.  The rim trail was beautiful.  The stairs were a nice challenge.  Lucifer Falls were very nice.  The Gorge trail was awesome with tons of spots to break off the trail and play in the water (they say no swimming, but lots of folks were doing it).  Then at the end (or before you start), the most beautiful natural swimming areas I've ever been too (complete with diving area) right on the Lower Falls.  Wish we lived closer so we could come here more often.
Long walk through shaded woods with a huge waterfall in the middle. lots of opportunities to dip a toe in, or more. Be ready for lots of steps, take lots of water. awesome hike.

We loved this hike! Lots of different scenery and the falls and gorges were unreal! It felt like every turn in the trail took us somewhere even more beautiful than before. There were a ton of little side trails, and we added nearly 2 miles exploring the banks along the water. Skip the bridge shortcut and continue on the entire rim trail, you won't regret it. Definitely overall more on the difficult side, and there were a TON of stairs. Trail is one way and most people were pretty good about masks when it got congested. Took us about 3:45 with lots of stops. Highly recommend.

Amazing hike with some incredible waterfall views! Another hiker wrote it here, but skip the shortcut bridge halfway through & keep going on the ridge trail to see Lucifer Falls. It will loop you back to the gorge trail. 10/10!
I only give this four because of the COVID restrictions but a nice hike with a little challenge.  Fun times all around.

Not everyone paid attention to the “one way” signs for the gorge trail, but there weren’t too many people that we had to step aside for. Absolutely beautiful trail. I will definitely be going back and exploring the finger lakes trails as well.

My favourite hike in Ithaca. Impressive falls and gorge walls. A nice volume of water when we went. Lush vegetation and interesting trails to hike through. This hike has a lot of steps and could be difficult for some.
Beautiful. Rim —> Gorge. One of my favorite hikes. Just as I remembered, worth the wait for the reopening of the Gorge trail.

Holy stairs, Batman! My husband and I just hiked the Rim/Gorge Trail loop this morning, and my legs are shaking now. We did a lot of research and read a lot of AllTrails reviews before committing to this trail. There are signs in the park directing hikers to take the Rim Trail up from the lower lot and take the Gorge Trail back down. Of course there were a number of people who apparently can't read signs, but what are ya gonna do without anyone around to enforce the rules. There were a few muddy spots, but they weren't bad. There was some stair replacement happening on our way back down the Gorge Trail and we had to carefully go around the workers. Swimming at the lower falls is currently closed due to construction/repairs. The waterfalls were amazing, definitely better than Taughannock. That said, once the Gorge Trail goes into the woods, visibility of some falls is disappointing. It would be nice if the trail ran closer to the falls the whole way instead of going back into the woods....a large portion of it seemed more like a rim trail than a gorge trail. Beautiful views, challenging hiking. I disagree with AllTrails' rating of moderate difficulty. This is not a hike for the faint of heart.

Great trail with good hiking combined with plenty of waterside views and waterfalls. Lucipher Falls is one you can’t miss! We continued up through the Rim trail instead of doing the short cut over the bridge to the Gorge trail. As long as you have the energy and water left, don’t shortcut. The views up there are unreal and it still loops you to the Gorge trail.

First time - the trail and view gets 5 stars all day every day. I would say 75% of the visitors did not wear a mask or follow the rule of going up the Rim trail and down the gorge trail, can’t be all that confusing. I actually received a few dirty looks for putting on my mask when having to walk by someone going the wrong direction. 1 star for the crowd and a note to photographers if you are reading this please GTFO of the way and let hikers pass. We started the hike at 11:11am and once finished a few hours later the lower lot was filling up quickly. I would recommend getting there earlier then we did to really enjoy it. There is plenty of spots off the trail to enjoy a beverage or lunch so fill your pack up. Please stay well and happy hiking.

Great trail! Beautiful views! Bring water! Due to covid the park is asking that people take the rim trail to start and then the gorge trail back. If four miles is too long for you, there is a bridge that will take you from Rim trail to forge trail so you don’t have to hike the larger 4 mile loop
Absolutely fabulous trail.  A must do if you are in this area.
Absolutely beautiful in the fall!!
Highly recommend doing this hike. Gorge trail is open but to limit direct confrontation with others you can only hike one way (starting from rim trial). Took about 2 hrs total.

Did Rim trail up and Gorge down, as you are directed to do during COVID so that you dont end up running face to face with any oncoming traffic. Puzzles me that some people still disregarded the rule. Also, wear the mask! From the few people I ran into, only a few had masks. The trail is really great though, especially the gorge trail. Go early to avoid crowds.
Only Rim trail was opened, Gorge trail was closed :(

-1 star for the crowd and the baffling lack of masks. seriously people, I was able to do it out and back, the whole way, and wear a mask, despite weighing over 350 lbs! beautiful trail, difficult for newcomers, but littered with humans unwilling to honor basic public health requirements for pandemics!

Really disappointed in our visit today. We quickly decided to get off the rim trail almost as soon as we got on because social distancing is not possible on the narrow trail, and there were a lot of people not wearing masks and not respecting distance/not paying attention to the space around them. Had multiple people almost bump into us both on the trail and down at the lower pool (despite there being a lot of space there). Maybe we’ll actually be able to enjoy the trail next time, because it seems beautiful
This trail is a beauty!  Excellent views of the falls and gorge.  Relatively flat besides the stairs up/out of the rim.  A lot of great spots to stop and take in the scenery.

Overall nice trail, well maintained with good views. Lot of people not wearing masks...6 ft can not be maintained thru most of the trail. We did out and back as the gorge trail is currently closed. Disappointed in the people using the trail more than the trail itself, shame to see such blatant disrespect. The park has posted signs everywhere to wear masks and provided distance in the parking areas.
Ended up on wrong trail, not from this area. Absolutely beautiful from what we saw. 21 May 20

Only the rim trail is open. Go early even during the week it got crowded. Hard to social distance on the narrow path. But people are mostly respectful.  Will for sure come back once covid is over to do the gorge portion of the trail and it’s less crowded.
Gorge Trail closed as of this review. Rim Trail was well maintained, provided terrific views with access to pristine pools and dog friendly. Subtract a star for Gorge Trail being closed.
Beautiful place with lots of waterfalls! Lots of stairs too!!!
Did this on the way out of town and wow. It should get more credit - beautiful waterfalls and trail. We did the gorge trail to Lucifer falls. Other than some elevation gain the trail isn’t too hard.
One of my favorite trails, in my favorite parks! A beautiful hike up and back down the rim trail since the gorge is out, but you still have great views the entire time.
Beautiful views of the falls. Gorge trail is currently closed.
Just down and back on The Rim. The Gorge Trail is closed
Great trail. Clean and well kept, beautiful waterfall
I’ve hiked this trail several times in the 13 years I’ve lived in the area. It’s always so pleasant and clean. My dogs love it here, I say this is definitely their favorite.

My brother and I had a great time on this hike. It was a rainy day and NO ONE else was here. Lots of nice views. We only did Rim trail gorge was closed but it was still a good distance. The end of the trail up to the mill was also closed but it was ok. We ended at a nice big water fall and then walked back quickly through the rain. Took 2 hours at a moderate pace.

Hiked the Rim Trail today to the Old Mill. The Gorge Trail was closed for the season. Park rangers warned that the Cliff Stairs towards the end of the Rim Trail may also close soon. Even though it was a little rainy and muddy, the view of Lucifer Falls was great, and it was nice to have the park to ourselves
Gorgeous!
Walking Lilie (sp, "Leelee") the White Bellied Caique with Yasmine, Maddie and Frank
Perfect trail for a fall hike!  The waterfalls are breathtaking.

We love this hike; both the Upper and the Lower Falls are picturesque!!  The color is just starting. My dog was sad that I wouldn’t let her swim (blue green algae concerns) but otherwise had a terrific time, as always. Only one tick, which is great.  We camped - it is just as noce as Taughannock for camping (and Treman has updated showers now!!

We had several attractions to see today so we did not do entire loop. Went to lower park entrance and took short walk to lower falls. We then started up Gorge trail but after half mile, realized that section is mostly just a steep walk in woods. We came back down and drove to upper entrance and came in Gorge trail from top. Almost immediately greeted by awesome narrow gorge with cascades and waterfalls. We hiked to Lucifer Falls and shortly after, trail returned to basically hike through woods.  If your goal is waterfalls and narrow gorges.. visit lower falls then drive to upper entrance and hike to falls and back.  Not knocking the entire trail though. I'm sure it is great if time allows.
Very Scenic. Did the rim and gorge trail loop. The rim trail is not scenic. I recommend the gorge trail there and back we went on a Sunday and it was well attended but not crowded.
Loved it here

Beautiful views and a fairly easy hike except for all the steps. We started at lower park and hiked the Gorge Trail to the top. Gorge Trail is by far the more scenic but Rim Trail will allow you to get at the bottom of Lucifer Falls which is a lot of fun. It also has a nice overlook of the swimming area.
beautiful place to go!

Excellent trail with multiple fantastic waterfall views. At the end there is even one you can swim in. Lots of diverse scenery. It was moderate due to length and some parts on an incline. It is very well maintained and feels safe all around.
Beautiful hike, went on a weekday in the middle of the day so escaped most of the crowds. Well maintained trails, decent work out if you keep up the pace!
Gorgeous views. Did this hike with my kids. Watch for ticks and bring insect repellant!

This trail is enchanting.  While I normally do not like crowded trails this one with the views of the various waterfalls was worth it.  We started at the Lower Parking lot and hiked to the Upper lot and then returned the same way. It is a steep climb in the beginning but worth the effort.  I would do it earlier in the morning to avoid the crowds.

We hiked this trail on a hot Tuesday, and it was fairly busy. We parked at the top and walked down the Gorge trail - the views were beautiful and we took lots of pictures around every bend. The swimming hole at the bottom was pretty busy and cold (64 F!) but still lots of fun. There are bathrooms and change rooms, as well as shade and picnic areas. We stayed for about an hour, and then headed up the Rim trail. The steps at the top are brutal, honestly, but that was by far the most strenuous part of the hike. It took about an hour each way at a brisk pace, but lots of photo stops, so we spent about 3 hours there in total. Definitely wear good shoes - NO FLIP FLOPS as we saw several people doing! I prefered this over Buttermilk Falls, personally.

This was a great day of hiking!  Waterfalls everywhere.  We did the gorge trail out and came back the rim trail.  The rim trail is less crowded but less water views.  It is a good workout.  We saw a lot of families with small children. It seemed to me that it may have been a little long for young kids.  It took us about 2.5 hours. The swimming area was closed yesterday die to bacteria count.  Was looking forward to swimming in the waterfall but that is how it goes sometimes.  I will just have to come back for a swim another day!  You will not be disappointed with this trail.
Beautiful trail with waterfalls around every bend.
A beautiful hike for the whole family. lots of steps.

This is my favorite trail in the area and I hike it several times in the summer. The gorge trail is closed during the winter, and while the rim trail usually remains open it does get icy at times. I recommend hiking up the gorge and back to the lower parkimg lot via the rim trail for the best views. I usually do this trail loop in under 2 hours  (moderate pace with a 'stroll' at the top to view the falls). A fair number of stairs and incline (which in my opinion makes it interesting), but my 9 year old collie does just fine. Also, a warning that you can not swim in the gorge- I have seen people get tickets multiple times for swimming. They do have a very nice guarded  swimming area near the parking lot though.
Great views of the falls. Trail was well maintained, moderate difficulty for the occasional hikers.
we loved it and it was great for our little dog and 7 year old girl.
Took children ages 8 and 9. They were tired but completed it! Beautiful! Plenty of places to stop and even swim.
Love this trail, second time doing it. This time with a large group of friends. A great time was had.
the trail is somewhat difficult there are parts of the trails that are currently being worked on, so it makes the conditions dangerous! nevertheless it was an amazing experience!
Really great workout!! Beautiful falls and scenery!
I was in awe at the beauty . Especially Lucifer falls
Cool swimming hole are the start/end of the loop.
Hike date 7/9/19 Not sure what the hype is.
Very beautiful ! Easy for children the views are amazing ! Would definitely come back !
Didn’t end up doing the full run due to time limits but some amazing views!
Hiking date: 6/24/19 Perfect temp Low humidity  Low bugs w/o repellent  Couple muddy spots only Stream refreshing for the feet
Perfect hiking weather with low humidity. Some bugs but not enough for repellent. Cooled my heels in the briskly flowing stream then headed back. Six month old prosthetic knee felt strong and stable.

Great hike. Took my 4 year old. Longest hike he’s been on. A lot of friendly people there.  Several encouraged him as we went. Lots of people with dogs. Swimming area closed until around 6/29/19 due to dredging, water flow, and bacteria count from recent rains.  Doing lots of trail construction.

Beautiful trail! The hills and stairs are daunting, but doable. The views of the water is worth it. The only thing I didn't like was how populated it was, because it made going at my own pace a little difficult. But, we did go on a Saturday in the middle of summer, so we expected it. I plan to go back and hike again.
awsome!

My wife and I hiked this trail today and it was a beautiful bright and clear day for this trail. There are several off trails to explore and we hiked 7 1/2 miles. If you want a less of a cardio workout, I recommend starting with the gorge trail and hiking the rim trail last. Furthermore, if you want to beat the crowds, arrive early in the day as both trails get heavily trafficked. Check out the Old Mill museum, it provides lots of great information and artifacts of how wheat was milled into flour in the 1800s.  Please note the rim trail signage is not clear as you enter the main entrance of the park. If you go to the camping/swimming area you will find the beginning of that particular trail.

A favorite of mine. Glorious weather, amazing critters such as chipmunks, birds, garter snakes, millipedes, insects and those I didn’t see! The water is amazing and the views spectacular! Had to pick up some litter but for the most part clean. Trail was muddy or washed out in some spots. I recommend good shoes and a hiking cane.
Great hike!! Incredible workout!! My pup liked it too
A little muddy in spots. Great for kids and dogs.
Great trail for family hiking. Several beautiful waterfalls and overlooks.
As everyone wrote, this is a great trail with beautiful views. Note that the gorge trail is closed until Memorial Day according to signs at the park office.

We did the Rim Trail only. The Gorge Trail was closed in early May. Rim Trail was very well marked & maintained. It had rained quite a bit earlier in the day but the trail was still decent - just barely muddy. Beautiful falls & views. Highly recommend.
Great hike! My dog Koda seemed to really enjoy it! Got my heart pumpin...

If you climb the steep hill west of the Lucifer Falls overlook it takes you to the Finger Lakes Trail on which you can loop back to the Rim Trail and return to the Upper Treman trailhead. The FLT has a couple steep downgrades, but is a pleasant variation for the return leg to the parking lot from Lucifer Falls.
Great hike but gorge portion still closed. Hiked rim to treman trail on way back . Pack water.

We did the south ridge hike out and back about 2 weeks ago. The trail was muddy but that’s to be expected. The scenes were beautiful- along with the waterfalls. The stairs that take you up to the north ridge/Lucifer falls area are closed during this time of the year but I believe open around Memorial Day. I think the Gorge Trail is also closed at this time. Easy hike and the elevation gain is slow.

Great hike with Dakota and Jake. It was perfect weather, mid to high 60’s with a great breeze. This is the first time coming to the Robert Treman trails, we will definitely be back. We couldn’t believe how beautiful the falls were!!
The gorge part was closed, but the rim side was a good hike with pretty falls!

I grew up in Ithaca and LOVE this hike. There are a lot of steps but other than that, it’s pretty easy. Pay attention to signs and don’t go around them. It is very slippery in the winter. During tourist season, this trail does become very busy.
Warm January day helped dry the one open trail. Good afternoon walk.

Waterfalls after waterfalls!! Beautiful trail for hiking and trail running. Very slushy at some places and slippery at others during this time of the year. Gorge trail was closed due to the snow and ice but the rim trail portion of the loop is open and  accessible.
Spectacular waterfalls.

A charming and leisurely hike.  There are a few sets of somewhat steep stairs, but the climbs are brief.  Beautiful waterfalls throughout.  A small picnic area at the top before you head back down makes for a great break for kids.

This was a beautiful, unique trail. The combination of man made structures and natural gorge were impressive to say the least. It felt like walking through a canyon built in biblical times on. The gorge trail and the rim trail had the most beautiful and literally breathtaking stair cases. I ran the 4.7 miles starting from the cabins and found that route excellent since the gorge trail was much more scenic and less challenging so it was a good way to cool down and end the run. Careful with the slippery stairs and maybe try doing this hike at the end of the day while the sun is just setting and rays of light drift through the lightly wooded forest and highlight the falls.
Hiked gorge to top and then took rim trail down- amazing falls on gorge trail A rim was quiet forest and so peaceful- lots of steps especially on gorge trail
Amazing views, minimal people and lots of stairs. Worth every step.

Really loved this hike. Lots of stairs at some points but just challenging enough to make it not feel like “a walk in the park”.  Tons of places to stop and put your feet in the water, beautiful waterfalls and the best part was at the end of the hike you end up at a swimming area and we swam up to the waterfall. Water was cold but totally worth it! Definitely bring your bathing suits. Very cool experience.

This is my favorite trail in Ithaca. Aside from being dog friendly it’s not too difficult-some stairs here or there. Beautiful views all around. If you come in the summer time you can go in the water. So much fun!
Nice trail. Very scenic. Lots of stairs to climb.
Beautiful hike into the gorge and to Lucifer Falls.  It many people on a Tuesday, which was nice! Lots of steps up and down and some steep inclines and declines. Loved it!!
Beautiful and not too hard hiking trail. You need a good pair of shoes tho. It can get muddy and slippery at some places.

This is a beautiful hike! Lots of stairs. There are several places along the trail where you can stop and dip your feet in the water. In the middle of the week its not too crowded. The whole trail is dog friendly, however if you're bringing a smaller dog they might have issues with the stairs on the Rim Trail towards the top as they are steep and there are alot of them. Bugs weren't too bad but you should plan for bug spray. Most of the trail has a canopy overhead so unless you're very fair skinned, sunscreen isnt really needed. At the upper park, there are plenty of picnic tables and charcoal grills to utilize.
Superb trail. Nice gorge and falls. Very moderate difficulties level. Anyone could do it. well maintained path with wood and/or stone stairs
Absolutely gorgeous hike with a huge variety of terrain. It’s true what they say: “Ithaca is gorges.”

Nice hike / walk. No climbing and not too difficult.  Less than 3 hours round trip including several stops. Beautiful views of the falls. Started at the lower lot and went all the way to the upper lot, then back. Took the rim trail up and gorge trail back.

After all the rain the Southern Tier received this week, water levels were high but not exorbitantly so - you could still see the shale formations under the stream and behind the waterfalls, and many tributary creeks were flowing in the woods. Perfectly gorgeous hike on a beautiful, cool, party-sunny day, a rarity this summer! It was an excellent workout, too. I would very highly recommend these trails, and hope to come back soon.

Amazing trail. I was initially disappointed that it was raining my only day in Ithaca but turned out for the best. There were hardly any people to contend with and it cooled me off on what couldn’t been a tough hike/trail run. I did a lollipop loop where I started at the south lot took a left halfway through to get the rim trail and then got back on the gorge trail at the north lot. Another advantage to parking the south lot was a cold refreshing dip afterwards!

We started from the south lot so we did all the elevation first, a lot of steps and inclines in this direction but not terrible. The views are spectacular from the rim and the gorge side once alongside the falls. The step on the rim trail took a good bit of effort but I was looking for that. If you’re looking for an easier route than you could Park 2 cars, one at each lot and start from the north to mostly skip the inclines. Really amazing spot and well maintained.
Fantastic hike today with a refreshing dip at the end at the lower falls ... highly recommend this spot if you are in the Finger Lakes region.
Unexpectedly beautiful and unique. Well worth it
Very lovely views, lots of nice spots to sit along the way. SOOO MANY STEPS! Picnic area was very nice. One of the better waterfall hikes upstate.
Lots of vertical change.  Trail heavily trafficked.   Not to bad around dusk.
Absolutely beautiful trail tucked in middle of the city. Hard to find this much scenery in such a short trail.
It was very fun but very heavily trafficked.
Great hike and wonderful views of the falls.  The climb can be steep at times.  Moderate stair climb.  We had a 10 year old kid who did it in his flip flops because he forgot his sneakers.
The falls are magical and there’s great picture spots all along the way.
Each water fall is fantastic and there are multiple spots to take a dip. The stone work and stairs make it seem like some pathway to a castle out of a movie.

Beautiful hike- just too populated and the trails are narrow. We completed the entire hike- all 5.6 miles, just out of preference, I would opt another trail purely for the sake of ease of manipulation of crowds.

Started in the afternoon around 3 on the Gorges Trail. It was extremely worth it to start low and feel the anticipation grow with each Falls view getting bigger and better. The last spot, upper view, on the stone bridge, was the Coolest and best spot in my opinion.   The Rim Trail from the top was pretty nice but devolved into a forest walk that was less strenuous than coming up.

Fun, challenging, beautiful views on the Gorge trail side. Easy-moderate trail on the Rim trail with peaceful quiet views of the deep forest and old gorge. I would HIGHLY recommend starting on the Gorge trail. Better payoff! Lovely at late evening/dusk. Nice swimming area at the low park waterfall.

Great trail! We did the Rim Trail all the way up to the upper level.  There's tons of spots for great pictures. Some people venture off the trails (Although, I'm not sure it's allowed per park signs) and waded/ sat in the rivers.    We wore boots even though a lot of the trail was paved/gravel, an old pair of tennis shoes would be fine. There are some inclines if you go up the Rim Trail to the top, which can leave you winded.  Traffic wasn't terrible either until you got to the actual falls, where people were taking pictures.     We were told by some couples to avoid taking the right at one of the splits, as there is no stairs and its just an uphill climb (more difficult).  Once at the top we came back down at turned right at the bridge that has a gate on it.  After crossing the bridge, it will take you down to the swimming hole where there is lifeguards and a diving board right in front of the falls.  I wish we would have brought swimsuits for this.  Definitely pack some river clothes, swimsuits if you have kids, its something they would definitely enjoy.
Nice hike just did a short loop.    Nice water flow today very enjoyable

Excellent trails.  Wonderful views and a Hell  of a workout, a lot of stairs. I would like to try the Red Pines trail off the Gorge trail.  Perfect hike with Sun, shade mud puddles and lots of wildlife! Great to see families out hiking!
I have done this trail several times and I love it every time. it is beautiful and a hell.of a workout with all the stairs. Love it !
Prettiest and coolest thing I have ever seen in my life... and I am not easily impressed.
I didn’t even go in the entire way so I am coming back tomorrow.. this is the coolest, prettiest, and most surreal place I’ve seen. It looks like some Egypt bathing place. Looks almost fake.
RH Treman State Park. A good work out (if you like climbing stairs!). Beauty all the way up the gorge trail. Haven’t tried the Rim trail yet.
This was my favorite in Ithaca this far. Start by taking the gorge trail then loop to the rim trail- this will provide great views facing the waterfalls then it's like a walk in the woods.

Great trail up through the Gorge to Bear trail to the Lake & back down to the Rim Trail. Didn’t record, easy trail to follow. Steps up the falls aren’t easy but a good workout. Sights are amazing through the gorge trail.
Definitely start on the gorge trail, the stairs on the rim trail will kick your butt on the way up but are easier on the way down.

Absolutely beautiful hike! We were there on a rainy day and we took the staircase downward! The waterfall was Gorgeous and the dog loved the little rocky ponds she could play in at the top of the falls!
Great hike with tons of shade and spectacular falls and vistas.

Gorge trail still closed, but you can walk a little way up Gorge from Old Mill parking Impressive what water can cut through Took Rim trail up to Lucifer Falls and down all those steps to bottom of falls.  Unless you plan on wading out to bottom of falls, stay on top and enjoy view of the entire falls Trillium ( mainly white with a few purple) and Jack in the Pulpit along trail
amazing views, great hike, worth the visit!

Really wonderful trail, it’s a bit intense if you aren’t used to climbing stairs. The gorge trail was closed when we went, but the rim trail was great and I think the other trail looked just as good if not better.

The gorge side is still closed. But out and back on the rim side is great too, so it’s a 4.5-5 mike out and back.   A little challenging workout on the way out. The first mile is uphill. Lots of roots and some loose rock but footing is fine. Several sections have steep steps.  A little busy today but clean, dry trails. Great views. Could easily get off the trail to make the hike and views more interesting.  Looking forward to trying the gorge side.

Was able to do half of the Loop.. Rim trail to the big water fall roughly 4 miles up and back. (Main parking lot to top lot and back).  Gorge Trail is still closed due to trees on most of the trail on that side.  A long steady uphill climb to the Big Falls...a great hike/workout...you can get to the stream if you need water with filter..good clear trail on Rim side. Great views..will be back to do the loop when open...
Very enjoyable hike

Nice park, the parking fee is $8.00 and both the rim and gorge trail lead to Lucifer falls. If you choose to climb the 222 steps to the overlook of Lucifer falls enjoy the view! Been coming here since I was a kid!
This is a great trail and a "must visit" for those exploring Cayuga waterfalls.
This trail is deceiving. The rim trail with the steps is more difficult than expected. Be careful of the terrain, it has a lot of roots and loose gravel
beautiful trail. the rim trail was only open in the spring , due to ice, but nice hike

*PLEASE NOTE THE TRAIL CLOSURE SIGNS.  IF THIS TRAIL IS CLOSED AND YOU TRESPASS, YOU WILL BE FINED*  ...I learned that the hard way.  Okay, so I made a huge mistake and ended up getting bucked off an open trail and onto a closed trail.  Upon arrival, I noticed the Gorge Trail closure was clearly posted.  So I took off on the Finger Lakes trail instead, hoping to catch some good Top-Down views of Lucifer falls.  Well folks, I ended up missing a trail marker, headed off down a deer path and wound up on the Gorge Trail.  I was stopped maybe an hour later by a state trooper who had been monitoring trail traffic.  I received a citation and was escorted out of the park.  Please keep an eye out for trail markers if you're here off season.    I thought a citation was a little harsh especially as there were other hikers out on the Finger Lakes Trail and the Rim Trail.  Since I wasn't from the local area, I had assumed since I saw other hikers that I was in fact, on the OPEN Finger Lakes trail.  Unfortunately for me I must not have navigated a junction properly and it cost me.  tl;dr - watch where you're going here.  if the trail is closed, they do not post markers at every junction, but only at the trail heads.  Enjoy the pictures I took though!  They only cost me ~$500 in fines :)
Awesome gorge trail.  So glad I got to do this while going to Cornell.  Been in summer and fall both were great.
Wonderful hike for an afternoon
Loved it! Quite challenging and a great workout! Beautiful place!

We were only able to complete the Gorge trail, the Rim portion was blocked off at the trail head. Beautiful scenery and great start of fall colors (though I'm from the Gulf Coast and we don't get any fall colors so I was easy to please).
Awesome 4.5 mile trail. Took me about 2 hrs with plenty of stops- so many waterfalls and views along this trail.
Not a bad hike at all. Pretty easy both ways. Dogs loved it as well!
Beautiful place!
great visuals
Lots of uphill... but so worth it!!

Great hike - I really enjoy hiking in places you can go right in the water and hike up the gullies.  While I prefer hiking narrow trails over paved or stairs, the stone steps and walls add to the hike.  Did this one first (of 3) on a camping trip this past weekend.  This is a great area and everyone we passed seemed to be enjoying the beautiful weather as well.

Well established paths, beautiful scenery, slow moving stream with little waterfalls here and there, and well maintained stairs....it was spectacular. I hiked on 8/15. It was a very warm day with light rain and breeze which made the experience even more fun! Loved every minute of it!
Great hike. Too many people on a Saturday morning
This is beautiful trail along the waterfall. Well paved with a lot of steps.

Start on rim trail, challenging start but well worth it once you get going. Lucifer Falls was spectacular. Lots of stairs but trail very well maintained. Hiked down gorge trail but not much to see. Hike early as it gets crowded later in the day. Breathtaking views!

08/13/17. Excellent hike. There are a considerable amount of stairs on the trail, but the effort is well worth it as you are met with various waterfalls after most ascents. Start on the Gorge Trail and make your way up a few sets of stairs bringing you level with the gorge. From here, every few minutes of walking yields great views until you arrive at the breathtaking Lucifer Falls. Finish out the Gorge Trail and hike down the Rim Trail, which covers the other side of the gorge. The Rim Trail is further from the gorge in most places but gives a quiet contrast to the Gorge Trail. Both trails add up to about 4.5 miles total. Don't forget to bring your swimwear and take a plunge off the diving board in the official swimming area near the base of the trail! The water is ice cold & refreshing. Best of all, you can hang out right on a waterfall that spills into the swimming area!

One of the best I've done near Cayuga. Less crowded than WH or Buttermilk. It's a solid climb - definitely recommend decent shoes w tread, but the view at the top is worth it. We did Gorge up and Rim down. Great morning!   Protip - bug spray!
Solid climbs.  Good to moderate surface with some gnarly roots.  Views are solid and some surface has been developed and secured with chain fence.  Worth a shakeout loop.
Nice and easy
Great trail for hiking.  The gorge trail is strenuous with a lot of stairs and isn't easy for young hikers.
This trail is waterfall!
Beautiful trail with amazing scenery.
Very beautiful park with some real charm and wonderful falls.
fun trail lots of foot traffic on a Sunday in summer.Trail is nice some steep stairs part for about 2 miles lots of rocks and roots for the first 1/2 mile
beautiful! well kept up and clean. so peaceful. more natural seeming paths than watkins glen.
wish I can give it 10 Stars the scenery was breathtaking well worth the trip

We learned something about what "moderate" means, but we made it anyways. Lots of climbing stairs up and down.  Sad thing was there were a few grannies and grandpas out hiking us.  It's beautiful slightly challenging and I loved it ! Ps... Bring tick and mosquito spray.

Love this place! Park at the parking lot at the old mill. There is a beautiful waterfall behind it and the walk to Lucifer falls is short and very rewarding.  You can also continue on the trail to the base of the falls and walk up to it through the water. Beautiful place and falls!
great trail. amazing falls
Gorgeous!
Great afternoon hike. State parks rock
Beautiful trails and friendly folks and stunning waterfalls along the way.  Highly recommend for dog owners.
The end is so worth it

This is a steep trail, but it offers fabulous views and makes for a nice, fairly moderate hike. It offers views of the waterfall and dogs can come too, as long as they are kept on a leash. It makes for a great hike in late spring, summer, and early fall. There is also a swimming hole that can get very crowded on the weekends, but makes for a nice cool off after the hike. All in all, it's a great hike with a lot to offer, and I definitely will be coming back!
Excellent trail. We've visited this repeatedly with friends and family over the past several years
Good trail, but had repair work that closed the bottom 1/2 mile.  Ended up doing an 8 mile out and back.
Gorgeous trail lots of stairs
Easy access. Good trail maintenance. Moderate crowds but can separate out on the trail. Great swimming hole. Dog friendly!
Beautiful gorge views, plenty of opportunities to get your feet wet, and a great swimming hole area.  Typical State Park crowds on weekends, but that's to be expected.
Beautiful! A hot, humid day to do both trails. A wonderful hike!
Absolutely breathtaking sights, I'm not too into the stairs and trails, more of a water hiker but you can get to the water pretty easy in a few places, so worth it
absolutely awesome
awesome park and great swimming holes!
Robert H Treman state park. Awesome. Real Gem. Fantastic gorges and falls, breathtaking!
Great place to hike and take a dip!!! Well maintained trails and the swimming hole has a diving board.
Went first weekend in August. Unfortunately the falls were almost dried up. But nice hiking pretty view.

The hike was beautiful! You walk along the waterfall and get to see the many stages of it. The water was low now because of the drought but the views were amazing! Depending on how you do the hike, you can make it easier and just walk part way down along the gala then turn around or if you are feeling ambitious you can do the whole loop along the falls including the steep stairs.

The views were great, and I definitely worked up a good sweat.  I wasn't sure what to expect for something listed hard, turns out it was a lot of steep inclines, and declines.  It was refreshing to see others on the trail, moderate to heavy traffic on a busy day, not too much to ruin the experience.
It is the most beautiful trail we ever hike the place is clean and the trail is kept in good shape.
A beautiful 5 mile loop with beautiful gorge views, waterfalls, and an old mill at the top.
I like the trail seeing natural view and waterfall. Got stairs at beginning and the end, besides that it's flat trail!!

This park is absolutely magical. What I loved the most is how you can actually go into the falls. The rock structures are amazing, the waterfalls are breathtaking, but the ability to get that up close and personal just makes this trail all the more worth it. I do like how it is a loop. The elevation drastically changes on the Rim trail but my 10 year old never broke a sweat going the trail. I was there a holiday weekend so there were quite a bit of foot traffic.
Nice trail.

If you want a challenge do the Rim trail first which is a little over 2 miles but going up the stairs will be a work out. As you work your way up you will see Lucifer Falls. At the end you could go back the same trail or just loop around and you’ll be at Gorge trail which follows along Lucifer falls and to Lower Falls. Very fun but not for beginners due to the elevation, but the trail is mark well.

If you leave the party is I advise you to do the trail and go back through the trail rim. the opposite is more difficult. if on the other hand you wish to see the fall Lucifer, to arrive by the west party, less long. Beautiful path along the river.

The Gorge Trail was closed today (5/16/2016); the upper part is scheduled to reopen by the end of the week and the lower part, hopefully by the end of next week.  Unfortunate considering that the upper part of the Gorge Trail is the best part of this lovely hike.
With Wife and two boys completed the rim trail in just over 2 hours.   Gorge trail was closed, was hoping to make the loop, instead we did the out and back.
Great hike, lots of stairs but not too difficult.
Very nice short trail. Not too crowded and had some good views.
Rim trail is nothing special. The gorge trails is the one you want, brings you really close to the falls.

The waterfalls are beautiful.  The trail is amazingly nice and forested. In spite of how busy it was it was still pretty tranquil. Went up the rim trail and down the gorge trail.  It was nice to see the splendor of the views on the way down.   Bring water. Bring a camera and a tripod.
Lots of steps which I felt the next day but worth it.  My first hike ever and am planning my future ones now.  I had a great day on these trails and Lucifer Falls were breathtaking!

Beautiful!  We made the mistake of going here after walking the rim trail at Taughannock so our legs were killing us when we left.  There are tons of stairs and it seemed like it was uphill going in and then somehow uphill again coming out.. but it was totally worth the pain. :)  It would've been much better if we had started out with fresh legs but the Park is stunning.  Looking forward to returning with the kids to swim in the summer.
One of my favorite places on earth!

If you love waterfalls, you need to visit this trail. I went midweek during Thanksgiving break and the trip was nice and quiet. I started from the Lower Park Gorge Trail and the initial ascent is quite a bit of work, but otherwise this trail is fairly easy and well-marked. The best view of Lucifer Falls is from the upper park Rim Trail.

One of the most beautiful and my personal favorite hiking gorge trail in the Finger Lakes region. Nicely groomed trails with moderate elevation on both rim and gorge trails. Beautiful waterfalls throughout the hike.
Real neat place.  The rim and gorge trails don't have many views... the gorge trail has more.  Definitely worth the visit but not as impressive as nearby Watkins Glen.

If you enter the trail from the lower end, at the Treman entrance, the first bit of the hike has a lot of uphill and stairs; but it's well worth the climb! Make sure you take the trail all the way to the upper lot. So many beautiful views.
I love these trails but dread the steep stair climb.
In love with this place!
Beautiful!!!
I find this funny because these falls are on the Gorge and Rim trails which are rated as easy (I left my review on that page.)
Fantastic hike!  Breathtaking views and very well maintained trail.  Definitely park at the bottom of the gorge, near the swimming area and do the climb first :)  lots of stairs but totally worth it
Great trail, but be warned you have to pay $7 to enter the park and use the trail
great hike..beautiful..so glad I did it!
We did the out and back section of the Rim Trail, but unfortunately because of recent rains the Gorge trail section was closed. It was a good hike just the same.
All trails open as of May 10, 2015.  Always a great hike; counted the numbers of stairs on the main set: be prepare to climb 222 steps!  All worth it, though.
My sister and I hiked this trails some years back, and it was just beautiful. Lots of stairs, but worth it.

8/17/2014  Still great hike even though part of the gorge trail is still closed for repairs.  Well worth getting to where the trail dead end (both from the top and the bottom) to appreciate the view and the beauty of the gorges.
Nice hike. good climbs (stairs). Beautiful landscapes and waterfall features. would do again. and so close to Ithaca.

Gorgeous hike. Lots of stairs and elevation, with beautiful waterfalls along the way. The upper part of the loop was still closed early November, so you can't do the complete loop and cut off about a mile by having to back track a little at the top. Hopefully they'll have that fixed by spring.

This is my favorite park in the area. The hike is a bit challenging, but so rewarding! You climb multiple sets of stairs, and encounter many beautiful waterfalls on your way to the top. There are cute bridges for picture opportunities throughout the trail, and the whole hike looks magical, especially during fall and summer. Definitely worth the challenge!

Gorge trail is a must ! The top of it was closed off due to flooding when we arrived but it was still an incredible view. The terrain was okay to hike I wouldn't call it strenuous the uphill climb back can be tiresome. Most the trail is moist dirt so be prepared to dip ur shoes in some mud.
The top section of the gorge trail is closed for repair but the loop is still a nice walk...
One of my favorites; the way back through the gorge trail is worth all the stairs to get to the top of the park!!!

Pretty solid hike. We started at the bottom and climbed up the Rim trail and back down the gorge. Rim Trail is a steady incline for the majority then it leaves you with a ton of stairs to climb which makes you really feel the burn. The Gorge trail on the way down wasn't bad at first as there are well maintained stairs, however, towards the bottom the decline becomes a little challenging. On the whole this was a very good hike and we all felt it the next day.
Not a bad trail to walk. Would advise you try it out.

Great weekend with my Handsome man and beautiful Angels! We took the gorge trial to Lucifer & Lower Falls and took Rim trail back... It made the perfect loop and enjoyed the many gorgeous falls along the way!! Bring water for its not the easiest hike with all those hundreds of stairs!!!
Here with my boyfriend Ronnie and my girls. beautiful day and trails!

The Gorge Trail is still closed (repairs needed) and will probably be until the end of May.  It is a beautiful trail that I would recommend starting from the bottom so you do not end up climbing the stairs at the end of the hike.  A nice mix of walking in between the tree, along the water (with beautiful waterfalls and swimming area), and in bright green meadows!  Gorgeous! If you don't go to the Lower Fall were almost everybody is the trail is about 4.7 miles and can be done in a couple of hours.
Sunday was a sunny perfect day for hiking Rim Trail.  Lots of other hikers as well.

This a wonderful hike, especially for those who appreciate beautiful waterfalls and a challenge (a steep grade throughout). The trail is well maintained, mostly hard-packed dirt and slate. The geographical features of the creek and various waterfalls are interesting, with Lucifer Falls being particularly spectacular - it's so tall! This is a pretty popular spot, so don't expect too much solitude spring - fall.

This is my favorite CNY hike. We have been here many times over the years and like to hike in prepared with snacks and water shoes, taking a few breaks in the gorge along with some water hiking. There tend to be crowds at the trail head on either end but not as many venture through and even less stray from the main trail. If you choose to go off the path into the gorge use caution.
What a nice surprise to start at the top of steep stairs head around gorge trail and end up at swimming area. A vigorous hike but a cool day.Blessed with a cool wind after each climb.   Beautiful.
This is a great hike on a warm day...

I had been at Ralph Treman State Park twice so far this year.   This is amazing hike to go on.  Lucifer Falls was so amazing.  If you park near the Upper Falls you are basically right on top of it once you get onto the gorge trail.   Lucifer Falls is amazing water fall with a bad name.

Robert H. Treman Swim Area.Name: Robert H. Treman Swim Area

parking lot: NY 13, 5 miles south of Ithaca, on NY 327. Lower park entrance is first and upper park entrance is further along NY 327.

More Info: Part of interconnected trail system: Yes
Use of firearms for deer hunting is not allowed. Bow hunting may be allowed. BE SAFE: See the specific trail owner/steward’s website for the most up to date details

Reviews.comment: It was a very cold day (20F), but a nice easy walk back with the kids. The path was narrow, but clear all the way back to the falls.
Very nice with waterfalls, nice trails and lots of beautiful spots.
Rough
So much fun!!!
Short walk to lower falls
Beautiful view of the falls
Stunning! Nice to swim
Great little trail with beautiful waterfalls! Was recommended to see by a hometown gentleman we ran into at Lucifer Falls.
Quick and easy with a beautiful falls at the end. I saw a guy pull a small rainbow trout out of the stream just  below Enfield Falls, but I had no such luck.
Beautiful day for a hike! Lots of people out so we went to the left of the swimming hole and took that trail!
Stay smart stay 6’ feet apart.
Great trail and a great veiw
Very short walk, gorgeous view and you can walk right up to the waterfall
great hike on gorgeous fall day.
Excellent fall hike! Lots of colors, good water flow I over the falls!! Watch your steep leaves are converting roots rocks and acorns!!
One amazing fall. Beautiful hike all around. No need to start from bottom, go to top and down to the really special one, then back up.
If you park at the lower parking lot, Very easy flat walk to the base of the Falls viewing area
Amazing trail with beautiful views.  Lots of steps and roots but a great workout.  Not crowded last week of August.
Beautiful falls!
great waterfall. come in the offseason if you want to avoid crowds.
Nice long secluded stretch on FLT combined with the standard loop around the falls.
It’s not really a trail and it can get overly crowded fast. Better off going through the entire park and finding your own swimming spot.
This is a short, flat walk to the waterfall at the swimming hole. If you're in the park to hike the gorge, it's worth the visit to this waterfall as well.
Ok hike around the falls. Water level was very low and falls were not that impressive.
great falls, easy walk and i saw wheelchairs going up & down the path. still a beautiful path in Novermber

Buttermilk Falls Lake Treman Trail.Name: Buttermilk Falls Lake Treman Trail
Buttermilk Falls Lake Treman Trail.Description: Buttermilk Creek drops 600 feet as it plunges through a gorge down the eastern slope of the Cayuga Valley at the southernmost edge of the City of Ithaca. Five trails in the park wander through a remarkable variety of landscapes.

parking lot: NY-13 S/NY-34 S/NY-96 S/Elmira Rd, 3 miles south of Ithaca (Lower/Main Park Trailhead).

More Info: Part of interconnected trail system: Yes
Use of firearms for deer hunting is not allowed. Bow hunting may be allowed. BE SAFE: See the specific trail owner/steward’s website for the most up to date details

Reviews.comment: Some stairs but not too bad
Nice views. Not really a lake, the elevation and a lot of leaves on the trail with no railings made us feel it should be labeled moderate. Overall, Ithaca is beautiful.
Great - they’re fixing the riverbank at the beginning, but after that it’s a beautiful trail. Lots of fun steep drops
Excellent trail good views!
Construction at beginning of trail otherwise nice trail
Easy quick hike and fairly easy terrain

Would have given this a 4.5 but figured I would round up!  Not too challenging but kept our interest. Did this with the husband and our 2 pups who absolutely loved it!  The rim/gorge trails were very crowded but once we got up to the bear trail area it was much less trafficked. Certainly ideal for covid-times.  When we got to the very end of the lake treman loop, we ended up venturing in further for another half mile or so by the water and it was really pretty. Recommend if you have some time to kill!  Overall great experience.
Nice short walk. But buttermilk and other state parks are just getting too crowded, even on weekdays, with maskless folks, making social distancing nearly impossible.
Easy to do with dogs and/or carrying a baby on your back!

We did this trail as an extension of the Rim and bear trails. It was a Monday so not too many people around.  The trail is very nice with flat easy surface as well as some elevation and stairs. The lake is not really a lake as its very dry so just a lot of reeds and grass and some trickling water.  Lots of birds.  There  are bath rooms at the beginning of the loop.
constantly changing elevation made for a good workout even though the trail was fairly short
Very nice trail and views. Some tricky parts to be careful of and possible congestion. Lots of stairs as well!
Nice trail. Really quiet. Lots of birds and other wildlife. My wife thought it could be labeled as moderate with the amount of stairs and elevation changes.
Lovely views! Easy access from small parking lot on Comfort Road. We saw a large snapping turtle and lots of other wildlife. Great views from on top of a waterfall at the south end.

Robert H. Treman Rim Trail.Name: Robert H. Treman Rim Trail

parking lot: NY 13, 5 miles south of Ithaca, on NY 327. Lower park entrance is first and upper park entrance is further along NY 327.

More Info: Part of interconnected trail system: Yes
Use of firearms for deer hunting is not allowed. Bow hunting may be allowed. BE SAFE: See the specific trail owner/steward’s website for the most up to date details

Reviews.comment: Alot of folks.. busy
Its so beautiful and peaceful.
Great trail. Gorge Trail is still closed, but the Rim Trail is a good out and back route. Several good views of waterfalls. Good amount of stairs and inclines.
Beautiful trail. The Gorge trail side is closed, but the rim trail is open. There was very minimal snow and ice, so I imagine by the time I write this it was already all gone.

Really a great hike. Somewhat strenuous and a great workout - worth it for the stunning views of the waterfalls.  Only downside is conditions were icy in March and slippery in some places and half of the trail was closed. Otherwise on a warmer sunny I’d imagine it’s even better.
Super cool trail!! Really pretty in the winter but bummer the other part of the trail is closed. Might be worth it to even come back in the spring to check out the rest of the trail.
great hike but limited route because of winter. gorge trail is closed and rim trail only goes to stairs 2 miles in
Along with Lucifer Falls this is one of the best trails and hikes we have ever done. I saw scenery that blew my mind. An absolute must.
Some places were a bit slippery due to ice. Also the trim trail, if you start at the lower falls, doesn’t go further than the bottom of Lucifer falls. The gorge trail is closed entirely.
Pretty in the snow. The final part of the trail with steps up to the falls is closed, but still a great hike.
gorgeous
Good except gorge trail is closed
Gorge trail is closed.
Went in November on a day with light snow. Great view of lucifer falls from both sides of the loop.

Beautiful trail but always busy, especially on the upper side around the mill and the falls. I like to take out of town guests here. The stairs kick butt, even for experienced hikers. Nice view at the top. The waterfall is stunning.
This trail was well worth it, amazing views throughout the hike even in the off season. Waterfalls were still flowing.  Would do again in a heartbeat
great hike. super well marked. a few steep climbs and descents. awesome views especially at the top of the mountain near the end of the rim trail and the start of gorge.
trails still one-way, up Rim, down Gorge. lightly trafficked later in the season, good views, elevations, stairs, can get muddy in spots.

We parked at the Gorge entrance and went down the gorge and up the rim trail. One way was nice because you don’t really run into anyone! On a Misty Monday is was blissfully uncrowded. Lots of stairs and stares, at the gorges waterfalls!!! I will be back!

Lovely trail, not terribly difficult but hard enough to make my ten year complain.  Lots of beautiful sights to be seen.  Make sure to hike all the way to the top, it’s worth the climb.  Beware of lots of young people without masks slippery wooden steps and Trump supporters too.
Lots of well-kept stairs. Beautiful views of gorge and waterfall. Bit crowded, but not terrible. Trails are currently one way due to COVID.
Awesome trails.  It is pretty intense especially going up the stone steps.  Highly recommend.  Can get very crowded on weekends though.

Got there at 9 AM on a weekday and only saw a few other people the whole time! It was raining, but there’s good tree cover for all but the part at the gorge. Tons of stairs, but the view is worth it. Love how clear the signs are about going one direction (though several people were going the wrong way anyway).

Great autumn hike!! If you don't want to do the full loop, start from the upper entrance (west) and you can go out on the Gorge Trail and then cross the bridge to the rim trail. You'll get a great view of the upper falls from both trails! We did the whole loop and enjoyed the whole thing, but if you just want the big falls, that small loop would be great.
Busy busy busy today

Such a beautiful walk. Steep-ish uphill climb at the front end, but nothing extreme or unmanageable. Walking down the path next to the falls is just beautiful.  Lots of leaves in the fall, so watch your step if you take the stone stairs.
Busy with people, but easy walk. Note that there’s a steepish walk on the way back. Beautiful, but waterfalls are pretty dry
The view at the beginning of the upper entrance is one of the best ever!
clean and not too busy. overall great places to stop and look at fall views and dogs loved it!
Very nice.
Breath taking worth your time great colors

Amazingly beautiful!!!! It really took by breath away for a bit.  Just so worth it.  We did the entire loop 4+ miles.  At some points I questioned my life choices but it was so well worth it.  The falls, the views all the cute dogs!!!!!! Just a great day. We got there nice and early and we had hardly anyone around at first, by the time we ended the park was packed.  So get there early to get the best light for pictures and get the area with minimal amount of people. The longer hike was perfect.

Started out at the Rim trail.. It hits you right away with a beautiful waterfall, then you begin your trek towards the Gorge.. There's nothing but some strenuous hiking for a bit, making you wonder if this will get any better than that first fall.. No worries, because IT DOES! The Gorge side of things is absolutely awesome.. Great visuals at basically every turn.. I drove 4 hrs with friends to get here, but it was totally worth it.
Went in the fall. It was beautiful!!! Highly recommend
Really pretty waterfalls! Hike was challenging at times, but overall really great.
Amazing. A nice challenging hike for a beginner like me. Amazing view
Great views on the upper part of the park
Really well marked. Great waterfall views. Would recommend!
Beautiful but too crowded.

Pleasant trail, mostly packed gravel or old asphalt. Nice view of (I think?) Lucifer Falls from the Rim Trail. We went on a Thursday morning and only encountered two other groups, one of which was going the wrong way, but everyone wore masks.
totally awesome!
Beautiful woods and gorge. Well traveled and maintained trail.
