However, the scenery is beautiful, and I encountered lots of wild life such as deer. Trails are not well marked in several sections so I'd recommend bringing a map or a compass just in case. I'd definitely do it again because of the many variations that it offers and because of it's low traffic (I didn't encounter anyone on my Saturday morning hike)

I loved this place.  Great scenery and enough elevation difference to consider it a real hike.  I didn't do the loop trail when I was there.  Did an out and back one but I found a nice area for pitching a tent a little ways in where there was also a lean to.  Altogether I got in about a 7.5 mile hike and I'm looking forward to going back to do the rest.
I recommend entering the park through Prospect Valley Road, especially if you have a vehicle that's low to the ground.
Climbed today 3/6/14 great hike.   Little icy still but great to get out there!!
A cool fall day but a nice hike in the woods!
Completed again on 4/6/2013 on a beautiful spring day!  A very nice trail not always well marked and at the time still icy... Will do it again though.

First of all it is marked WRONG on this website. Other then that this is one of the best trails I have every been on. I would give it 5 stars but the trails need to be marked out better. I even had a map on my phone and still got a little lost. Who ever works this trail system does a very good job.
This is an excellent trail. Slightly challenging but very enjoyable

Shindagin Hollow Y5.Name: Shindagin Hollow Y5
Shindagin Hollow Y5.Description: Shindagin Hollow State Forest is a well known place for mountain bicycling. Twenty miles of mountain bike trails are maintained through a DEC Volunteer Stewardship Agreement with Cycle-CNY, an International Mountain Bicycling Association (IMBA) affiliated club.  The Finger Lakes Hiking Trail (FLT) also crosses the forest providing a well marked hiking trail in a forest setting. About 5.7 miles of the FLT is on Shindagin Hollow State Forest and is maintained through an Volunteer Stewardship Agreement with the Cayuga Trails Club and the Finger Lakes Trails Conference.  Four miles of snowmobile trail cross the forest and are maintained by the Candor Valley Rider Snowmobile Club through a Volunteer Stewardship Agreement.  Horseback riding is prohibted on this forest.  Also consider using the State Lands Interactive Mapper available on the DEC website at http://www.dec.ny.gov/outdoor/45415.html to view the current recreational opportunities on State Forests.

street: Parking Lot on Braley Hill Rd and on Shindagin Hollow Rd

More Info: Part of interconnected trail system: Yes
Hunting is allowed on this trail - use caution.

Reviews.comment: Love it
Awesome!!

This is one of my favorite trails I have done this far. I first came in the spring when the creeks were over following and the trail lead you right throw them. They are dried up now and parts of the trail a little over grown, plus some trees have fallen causing the trail to divert a little. Still a fun challenge highly recommend!

Peaceful and remote. The FLT goes up fairly steeply from the road, and follows a ridge line for awhile with great forest views. The blue/green/yellow trails are sparsely marked and a bit confusing. They take just a bit of faith but are generally easy to follow (at least the green 2 trail is). Parts of the green 2 trail are quite steep going downhill, which I imagine would be pretty fun on a mountain bike. At top of hill near the junction between the FLT and the DEC colored markers there’s a nice place for campfires.  The FLT passes what looks to be a very old stone cabin in the woods. Great area for exploring. We’ll be back. Bonus: a giant patch of lycopods!

Tough climb to start but generally flat with only minor elevation changes once on the loop.  Not many views but a very enjoyable outing no less.  The only hikers I saw were on Shindagin Rd at the beginning of my hike but I moved off the path regularly once onto the loop for mountain bikers.
Nice trail. A little confusing in one part- ended up off trail but got back on quickly. A good steep climb in the beginning. Not too bad coming back down at the end.

We tried to go on a short hike with the dogs and ended up doing about a mile of the white trail. I wish we had looked up a trail map ahead of time bc it sounds like some others have gone on great short dog hikes. We followed this trail and it was disappointing. Mostly uphill, no water, no views, really buggy.
Be careful in the wooden bridge. Angry yellow jackets live under it.  I do NOT think that this trail is easy... the first uphill climb is STEEP!!!  The rest is beautiful and rolling.

This is a very pretty trail. Once you leave the Finger Lakes Trail portion, though, it isn’t very well marked. Couple that with the fact that the area is crisscrossed by a  myriad of trails helps to explain why this 5.8 mile hike ended up 7+ miles long. Thank goodness AllTrails kept alerting us to wrong turns!

pretty nice area, trails firm and dense forest. website says you can park anywhere you want on the gravel roads here, and people were. there is a few turnaround/pulloff type parking spots, and small dirt lots at major junctions and exits scattered about. Massive amounts of berries and medicinals
Wonderful hiking trail that also doubles as an experienced mountain biking trail. Saw about 10 different trail riders.

Very lovely trail! We did as someone else suggested and parked slightly north where the Jeep Trail starts. There is plenty of parking and the seasonal road is in good condition. This route definitely cuts the steepness, but there is still a nice, steady incline to get to the looped trail.  Markers could be better. I recommend downloading the map ahead of time so you don't miss a turn. The trail is in great condition and there was very limited mud today even though it rained two days ago. Bugs weren't an issue today, but it was also cooler today compared with the rest of the week.  We saw about 6 groups of people. Two were backpacking the FLT, three mountain biking groups, and one other hiker. Since mountain bikes are common, it's probably a good idea to keep your dog leashed. My dogs loved it. I have a 9 year old collie and a 3 year old Australian Shepherd and both did great.

The hill from Prospect Valley road was the only part of the hike I disliked. Going up of course but also going down at the return trip. We have had a lot of rain these past few days so the mud on some parts of the trail was expected. I would be cautious with young children on the edge of the ravine as it is very steep! A few creek crossings got our feet slightly wet but not impassable. Had no cell service the whole walk. Bugs were bad only when we stopped. Used bug spray and didn't discover any ticks.  Very pleasant day. Enjoyed being outdoors!!
More moderate than easy.
Very lots of black flys.  Bug spray a must. Trail is in good shape but lots of mud from run off.  Liked this trail a lot.
muddy and lots of water to cross but a great hike!!!
easy and scenic.

I suggest starting where trail 1 hits the Jeep trail a bit north from where this says to start on the finger lakes trail.  The starting point listed here is sometimes muddy and always a steep climb to get to the loop.
A little muddy, but nothing all that bad if you have hiking boots. We took the suggested AT route and it was a nice hike. A few hills, but nothing overly exerting if you're in ok shape.
Not as easy as it is rated...
FLT Shindagan Hollow, quite muddy, beautiful woods, moderate hike
First time hiking this was a bit of an experience, the bugs were bad but was a great hike overall. Will try different trails next time
good hike for the first day of spring with the doggo
Excellent. cant wait to go back and explore more.
Great trail.
Yes! Bears Do shit in the wood! Saw a fresh paw print that REALLY got me moving! Had to be 700 pounder!
Bears, we found do NOT always hibernate! 600lbs we guess! Moved REAL FAST after that!
Just beautiful. Can be as easy or difficult as you want. Some trails are very steep, some are old Jeep roads!

Beautiful hike! I'll be back soon to take advantage of the fire pit and lean to (about 3/4 miles in). Lovely small waterfalls and a few old stone remnants of houses. The trail is usually well marked, but I found myself guessing at times. Great scenery, would recommend

Beautiful woods and the trails are not too muddy in Mid-June. Be sure to download the map trails as the signal for mobile phones is too poor there. Small, lovely waterfalls good for wading. Also go through the AllTrails app to find the trailhead, Google maps will send you into the middle of nowhere! There was a nice lean-to for overnights, and the whole thing was very nicely maintained. I just wish we had had the map, because we were just guessing. We'll be back better prepared!

I'd rate this trail Easy to Moderate compared to Breakneck Ridge (Hard) and Mount Hadley (Moderate). The trail is not too steep, and with an even surface throughout. There's many variations that could upgrade it's difficulty to Medium-Hard because of very steep sections but definitely there's no scrambling involved. However, the scenery is beautiful, and I encountered lots of wild life such as deer. Trails are not well marked in several sections so I'd recommend bringing a map or a compass just in case. I'd definitely do it again because of the many variations that it offers and because of it's low traffic (I didn't encounter anyone on my Saturday morning hike)

I loved this place.  Great scenery and enough elevation difference to consider it a real hike.  I didn't do the loop trail when I was there.  Did an out and back one but I found a nice area for pitching a tent a little ways in where there was also a lean to.  Altogether I got in about a 7.5 mile hike and I'm looking forward to going back to do the rest.
I recommend entering the park through Prospect Valley Road, especially if you have a vehicle that's low to the ground.
Climbed today 3/6/14 great hike.   Little icy still but great to get out there!!
A cool fall day but a nice hike in the woods!
Completed again on 4/6/2013 on a beautiful spring day!  A very nice trail not always well marked and at the time still icy... Will do it again though.

First of all it is marked WRONG on this website. Other then that this is one of the best trails I have every been on. I would give it 5 stars but the trails need to be marked out better. I even had a map on my phone and still got a little lost. Who ever works this trail system does a very good job.
This is an excellent trail. Slightly challenging but very enjoyable

Six Mile Creek Natural Area.Name: Six Mile Creek Natural Area
Six Mile Creek Natural Area.Description: The Six Mile Creek Gorge is a diverse ecological area consisting of streams, gorges, waterfalls, marshland, forest, and meadows of goldenrods, asters, shrub thickets or young forests.  The natural area offers level, creekside walks in the Mulholland Wildflower Preserve on the north side of Six Mile Creek. Steep cliffside trails can be found on either side of the creek.Â This area contains the City of Ithaca's reservoirs and is also designated as a unique natural area.  The area has many miles of unimproved and minimally maintained trails on both sides of the gorge from the Mulholland Wildflower Preserve to the 60' Dam. All blue-blazed trails on both sides of the creek are kept clear of obstructions.

parking lot: street parking or downtown parking garages

More Info: Part of interconnected trail system: Yes
Use of firearms for deer hunting is not allowed. Bow hunting may be allowed. BE SAFE: See the specific trail owner/steward’s website for the most up to date details

Reviews.comment: Lovely AM hike!
Not six miles.
Trail divergence wasn’t clear
AllTrails is all wrong about this trail. It dead ends and you have to wander to reconnect with the trail. Also, it’s 3.3 ONE WAY. You still have to hike back. It’s beautiful though!

Nice trail, the first half is well marked but the blazes definitely disappeared after that. We got off track a couple times but enjoyed ourselves. Also agree with a few other reviews that it may not be an “easy” trail. Nothing hard but a few of the up & down hills were pretty muddy/slick.

Very nice, definitely steep in places. Beware of shifting, loose shale on some parts of the trail, can be slippery. The woods are very picturesque, like something from a fairy tale. Like a lot of trails around here, there are dozens of ways to do it. Definitely recommend this gem right in the City of Ithaca.
Nice trail along the creek! lots of spots for the dogs to play in the water. Well maintained, mostly flat trails. Pretty hike!
Beautiful easy walk. Will do again.
City meets the woods in this easy as pie trek.

So much more than I expected.  Go beyond the AT  turn around point & there's a large spillway from Cayuga Lake (I think). I ran upon a man @ Potter's Falls & he said that area was 'clothing oppitional' as he took off his shorts and walked into the cool water. Getting there some parts of the trail are quite steep.
Great little trail for an early morning walk. The pathway near the dams gets a little narrow - beware and be light-footed.

Trail is a little hard to follow, but otherwise very nice. Can be crowded towards the beginning and at the end of the trail. Limited parking, so get there early or you will need to find street parking. Also lots of people partying, so be weary of crowds closer to the water.

This trail was absolutely beautiful and well maintained. Plenty of spots to enjoy different views of the waterfalls. I was able to see different animals such as, frogs, chipmunks, snakes, blue jays, amongst other birds. It is a very small parking lot. Early bird gets the worm  also dog friendly
I
Beautiful place to appreciate nature. Parking lot is small.

The Wildflower Preserve is wonderful for walking, running, and dog walking. Nice and useful parking lot right outside of the entrance to the wildflower preserve. Across the road is the entrance to Six Mile Creek, and when the river/waterfall dries up, you can sit on the rocks under the bridge! Lots of places to explore all under 3 miles in length.   EDIT: After further exploring, there is much more to do here than expected! Many trails here, some go as far as five miles away from the preserve and lead to a huge dam! Really impressed with this trail.
Nice trail. But get there early parking lot fills up fast

nice meandering trail. the closer you get to the creek, the more it feels like air conditioning. some nice, off the beaten path finds like what looked like an old stone step in walk down to a picturesque view of a tributary to six mile creek. it was overgrown and in that way, surreal.

hiked on 6/9/19  awesome stroll through the woods, nice and flat overall, with alot beauty to take in, lots of small falls with some larger ones at the end. some spots can be muddy if it's rainy. lots of wild flowers and it's an all around great hike with minimal effort. our lab also enjoyed playing in the water there!
Decent winter hike. Lots of melting and mud and the trail was very slick with ice! Good dog walk. Couldn’t go past the potter falls as trail was too dangerous this time of year!
Great hike and easy to get too off the road

Great trail along the pipe, 3 waterfalls, very peaceful dirt trail. there is a steep hill trail across the street from the parking area a quarter of a mile to see another water fall. alot of dogs not on a leash but all very friendly
Too many people and not keeping their dogs on a leash. Twice our dog was attacked because of this
pretty walk along the creek when you want to get to top of last waterfall that's where it is most strenuous but worth the ☮️ and beauty
Took this hike in late February. Trail could use some maintenance but over all not bad. Definitely worth checking it out.

This is an awesome place and one of my favorites when I just can't decide where to hike. Easy areas or challenging areas depending on what you feel like. You can jump across the street to the Wells falls area and do two great hikes in a day. Highly recommend this area for am easy or strenuous hike depending on what route you take.
easy walk. even though it is dry, it was a nice little walk
I came in from rt 79 to potters falls just use caution as the trail is steep and you may in counter nudity at potters falls
Pretty trail, with a nice lake at the end. I tried exploring a pretty waterfall and a trail from there but ended up getting lost. Good trail for a jog.
Pretty good trail. Lots of offshoots and places to explore. Once you get to know it it's a great jog. Many waterfalls and places to swim
Great hike along six mile creek. Seeing the waterfalls at the reservoir was a nice treat as well. If you fancy cliff jumping and swimming then bring your suits ;-) terrain was of no issue.

Great hike not far from the center of Ithaca. Within walking distance. The numerous waterfalls are quite spectacular.  Most of the trails are pretty tame.  You have to search a bit for some vertical stuff. Trails are very well marked and worn!

Cayuga Waterfront Trail (Stewart Park).Name: Cayuga Waterfront Trail (Stewart Park)
Cayuga Waterfront Trail (Stewart Park).Description: The Cayuga Waterfront Trail is an 8 mile, ADA compliant multi-use trail providing an active, non-motorized transportation and recreation way connecting our community's most popular waterfront destinations along the southern shore of Cayuga Lake. The wide, flat trail connects East Shore Drive, the Ithaca Youth Bureau,  Stewart Park, Newman Golf Course, Ithaca Farmers Market,  Ithaca College and Cornell University Boathouses, West End/Inlet Island area, Allan Treman State Marine Park, Ithaca Dog Park, Hangar Theatre, Cass Park, The Ithaca Children's Garden and the Black Diamond Trail. Amenities along the trail include interpretive signage, benches, restrooms and dog care stations in Stewart Park and Cass Park, a fitness station and maps at the 5 trailheads. Nearly all of the Cayuga Waterfront Trail is 10-12 feet wide and paved, with the exception of a few stonedust side paths and a few narrow bridges.

parking lot: Parking in Farmer's Market and on city streets along the trail

More Info: Part of interconnected trail system: Yes
Use of firearms for deer hunting is not allowed. Bow hunting may be allowed. BE SAFE: See the specific trail owner/steward’s website for the most up to date details

note that the Waterfront Trail around Cass Park is plowed and maintained by the city, making this the best local choice for winter walks during snowy conditions. adds to the crowds though.
Awesome  worth the travel to get here.
just past peak foliage 10/31, still some good color though.
Pretty walk along Cayuga Lake. Trails are paved, so great for biking, strollers, etc. More of a walk in a park than a hike in the woods. Pretty busy.
few bumpy cracks by small parking area at cass park but other than that, great trip!
Great scenery and very relaxing
pretty walking trail

Ithaca Falls.Name: Ithaca Falls
Ithaca Falls.Description: Beautiful year-round, 100' verticle fall by 150' wide with cliffs rising another 100'. Visible from Lake St. bridge or a couple minute walk to the base of the falls. Red Tailed Hawks nest on cliffs above, Turkey Vultures and many other birds take advantage of air currents, a popular fishing hole as well.  Swimming is illegal and currents near the falls are deadly. While the park entrance is fairly flat and provides a wheelchair accessible path to overlook the creek, the path heading toward the falls can be somewhat rough and uneven. A short, but somewhat steep trail enters the woods and loose stone and earth paths provide access to Fall Creek and up close to Ithaca Falls.

street: Falls St/Lake St intersection

More Info: Part of interconnected trail system: No
Use of firearms for deer hunting is not allowed. Bow hunting may be allowed. BE SAFE: See the specific trail owner/steward’s website for the most up to date details

Reviews.comment: Ithaca Falls is an amazing waterfall especially with the spring runoff. Unfortunately being in a very urban environment has hurt it as there’s plenty of graffiti and trash to be seen as well.
Short little hike with view of falls and gorge.
Nice and easy walk back to the falls.

The trail is very short , a short distance right in town that heads to the beautiful falls , lots of fisherman , was a lil upsetting to see the town allow graffiti to stain such a beautiful place and not at least try and cover it up or do more to prevent such things from happening in such a populated pretty area :(

The best waterfall we saw while staying in Ithaca. This trail is located within the main city and there is ample parking near the entrance of the trail. There were several people fishing the stream too if you are interested. You can literally walk up to the waterfall if you would like.  There are warnings of contaminated lead soil in the area but just be smart and don't go digging around.
Wasn’t a hike at all ... but it’s a very cool water falls ... very relaxing and calm ... I enjoyed my 2hr lunch haha
Nice, short trail with a pretty waterfall at the end.
I always bring people friends and family visiting Ithaca here! The "trail" is basically a 1-2 minute walk so super accessible. The falls are the best in the area imo!
Lovely. Looks from the car. Parking wasn’t easy to find.
Beautiful falls even with the dry weather we’ve had.
Not much of a trail so much as a very short walk! We added mileage by walking from home and got some nice inclines through Cayuga Heights. Falls were still beautiful even during a dry season.
Beautiful falls Quick walk.

(Aug 2019) This is a very short walk to a very cool waterfall.  The thing that really makes it is how it reflects in the pool below.  This place is super popular so it's tough to get really good photos without a lot of people around but if you're patient you can get some great reflection photos that make you forget you're pretty much in the middle of town.
Easy walk for anyone. Sooooo beautiful!
Beautiful waterfall. Worth the easy walk to the base of it.
short but pretty.
Great waterfall for a short hike
A great experience. The vast waterfall is right in front of you. Easy access, great view, magnifique!
Definitely not a hike, short walk 2 maybe 3 minutes to the falls. But wahouuuuu, amazing waterfall!
Awesome waterfall one of the best I’ve seen
cool big waterfall
Not much of a trail. Falls are visible from bridge for those who can’t make it out there.
Not much of a trail. Nice falls

For a photo map, parking location, and a trail recording, go to https://www.alltrails.com/explore/recording/ithaca-falls-trail-a4d5fad   Ithaca Falls is a very beautiful waterfall, within a short walking distance of Lake Street. The trail begins on the right side of the bridge on Lake Street. It is an easy walk to the falls. This trail goes to only one waterfall, Ithaca Falls, and ends there. There are four other waterfalls just upstream from Ithaca Falls (Forest, Horseshoe, Rocky, and Triphammer Falls), but the trail to those falls begins on Stewart Avenue. In the link above, I posted a picture of the map that is on the bridge on Lake Street. It gives directions on how to walk to that upstream section of the trail from the bridge on Lake Street to Stewart Avenue (ten minute walk on street sidewalks, but it is steep). Also in the link above, I have GPS coordinates to where I parked in an Ithaca school parking lot, which is across the street from the trailhead on Lake Street.    May you always find peace in the scent of fresh air, in the way breeze feels against your skin, in the glistening reflection of a splashing creek, and in the sound of wind in the trees. Stay humble. Stay kind. Stay thankful. Keep hope. Keep smiling. Keep laughing. Love and respect nature, because that is where you will find a true lifetime of happiness! Also love and respect everyone who crosses your path. There is a reason why they did. If I see you on the trail, I promise to say "Hi" :-)
Short trail but gray view
Short walk to falls but nice scenery. The falls are impressive. It’s a nice spot to just relax and take in nature .
Beautiful waterfall...short walk
Super easy, beautiful waterfall and pool!
156' high.  MASSIVE.
The trail to the waterfall is very short. The sight is super beautiful.

Nice little walk. Gorgeous falls but not a hike or worth a whole day trip just to see it, nice though if you’re in the area! And close to other local sights and waterfalls. Usually pretty busy since it’s in Ithaca and right by Cornell University and so easily accessible
East short trail right in town with beautiful waterfall.
Not really a trail, just a short path, but worth it to stop and see the waterfall if you are in the area.
Crowded

This trail isn’t to much of a hike, it’s more of a view then anything. Would recommend if you want to get some beautiful pictures!

Really beautiful!
Easy trek in but very well worth. We went in a Sunday and there were quite a few visitors. Still a beautiful sight!!

The falls is fantastic -quick incredible, but this isn’t a hike.It a simple walk to the falls.
not a hike just waterfall

note that the Waterfront Trail around Cass Park is plowed and maintained by the city, making this the best local choice for winter walks during snowy conditions. adds to the crowds though.
Awesome  worth the travel to get here.
just past peak foliage 10/31, still some good color though.
Pretty walk along Cayuga Lake. Trails are paved, so great for biking, strollers, etc. More of a walk in a park than a hike in the woods. Pretty busy.
few bumpy cracks by small parking area at cass park but other than that, great trip!
Great scenery and very relaxing
pretty walking trail

Sixmile Creek Walk.Name: Sixmile Creek Walk
Sixmile Creek Walk.Description: An urban walk along the creek as it passes offices, apartments, restaurants, shops and the Tompkins County Library.

street: street parking or downtown parking garages

More Info: Part of interconnected trail system: No
Use of firearms for deer hunting is not allowed. Bow hunting may be allowed. BE SAFE: See the specific trail owner/steward’s website for the most up to date details

Reviews.comment: Lovely AM hike!
Not six miles.
Trail divergence wasn’t clear
AllTrails is all wrong about this trail. It dead ends and you have to wander to reconnect with the trail. Also, it’s 3.3 ONE WAY. You still have to hike back. It’s beautiful though!

Nice trail, the first half is well marked but the blazes definitely disappeared after that. We got off track a couple times but enjoyed ourselves. Also agree with a few other reviews that it may not be an “easy” trail. Nothing hard but a few of the up & down hills were pretty muddy/slick.

Very nice, definitely steep in places. Beware of shifting, loose shale on some parts of the trail, can be slippery. The woods are very picturesque, like something from a fairy tale. Like a lot of trails around here, there are dozens of ways to do it. Definitely recommend this gem right in the City of Ithaca.
Nice trail along the creek! lots of spots for the dogs to play in the water. Well maintained, mostly flat trails. Pretty hike!
Beautiful easy walk. Will do again.
City meets the woods in this easy as pie trek.

So much more than I expected.  Go beyond the AT  turn around point & there's a large spillway from Cayuga Lake (I think). I ran upon a man @ Potter's Falls & he said that area was 'clothing oppitional' as he took off his shorts and walked into the cool water. Getting there some parts of the trail are quite steep.
Great little trail for an early morning walk. The pathway near the dams gets a little narrow - beware and be light-footed.

Trail is a little hard to follow, but otherwise very nice. Can be crowded towards the beginning and at the end of the trail. Limited parking, so get there early or you will need to find street parking. Also lots of people partying, so be weary of crowds closer to the water.

This trail was absolutely beautiful and well maintained. Plenty of spots to enjoy different views of the waterfalls. I was able to see different animals such as, frogs, chipmunks, snakes, blue jays, amongst other birds. It is a very small parking lot. Early bird gets the worm  also dog friendly
I
Beautiful place to appreciate nature. Parking lot is small.

The Wildflower Preserve is wonderful for walking, running, and dog walking. Nice and useful parking lot right outside of the entrance to the wildflower preserve. Across the road is the entrance to Six Mile Creek, and when the river/waterfall dries up, you can sit on the rocks under the bridge! Lots of places to explore all under 3 miles in length.   EDIT: After further exploring, there is much more to do here than expected! Many trails here, some go as far as five miles away from the preserve and lead to a huge dam! Really impressed with this trail.
Nice trail. But get there early parking lot fills up fast

nice meandering trail. the closer you get to the creek, the more it feels like air conditioning. some nice, off the beaten path finds like what looked like an old stone step in walk down to a picturesque view of a tributary to six mile creek. it was overgrown and in that way, surreal.

hiked on 6/9/19  awesome stroll through the woods, nice and flat overall, with alot beauty to take in, lots of small falls with some larger ones at the end. some spots can be muddy if it's rainy. lots of wild flowers and it's an all around great hike with minimal effort. our lab also enjoyed playing in the water there!
Decent winter hike. Lots of melting and mud and the trail was very slick with ice! Good dog walk. Couldn’t go past the potter falls as trail was too dangerous this time of year!
Great hike and easy to get too off the road

Great trail along the pipe, 3 waterfalls, very peaceful dirt trail. there is a steep hill trail across the street from the parking area a quarter of a mile to see another water fall. alot of dogs not on a leash but all very friendly
Too many people and not keeping their dogs on a leash. Twice our dog was attacked because of this
pretty walk along the creek when you want to get to top of last waterfall that's where it is most strenuous but worth the ☮️ and beauty
Took this hike in late February. Trail could use some maintenance but over all not bad. Definitely worth checking it out.

This is an awesome place and one of my favorites when I just can't decide where to hike. Easy areas or challenging areas depending on what you feel like. You can jump across the street to the Wells falls area and do two great hikes in a day. Highly recommend this area for am easy or strenuous hike depending on what route you take.
easy walk. even though it is dry, it was a nice little walk
I came in from rt 79 to potters falls just use caution as the trail is steep and you may in counter nudity at potters falls
Pretty trail, with a nice lake at the end. I tried exploring a pretty waterfall and a trail from there but ended up getting lost. Good trail for a jog.
Pretty good trail. Lots of offshoots and places to explore. Once you get to know it it's a great jog. Many waterfalls and places to swim
Great hike along six mile creek. Seeing the waterfalls at the reservoir was a nice treat as well. If you fancy cliff jumping and swimming then bring your suits ;-) terrain was of no issue.

Great hike not far from the center of Ithaca. Within walking distance. The numerous waterfalls are quite spectacular.  Most of the trails are pretty tame.  You have to search a bit for some vertical stuff. Trails are very well marked and worn!
